Attribute.Name: API gravity
Attribute.Description: API gravity is a measure of how heavy or light a petroleum liquid is compared to water (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/API_gravity), e.g. 31.1 API

Attribute.Name: EDTA inhibitor tested
Attribute.Description: Was carbapenemase activity tested in the presence of EDTA? If carbapenemase activity was tested in the presence of EDTA, the response should be "yes", otherwise "no”.

Attribute.Name: FAO classification
Attribute.Description: soil classification from the FAO World Reference Database for Soil Resources

Attribute.Name: FDA food industry class name
Attribute.Description: The US FDA Class is the second of five elements that comprise a FDA product code. This element is directly related to an Industry and designates the food group, source, product, use, pharmacological action, category or animal species of the product. A Class code is more specific than an Industry; for example, the Fishery/Seafood products Industry may contain Classes such as Smoked, Breaded and such, e.g., Coffee, Decaffeinated

Attribute.Name: FDA food industry code name
Attribute.Description: The US FDA Industry Code is the first of five elements that comprise an FDA product code. An Industry code determines the broadest area into which a product falls, e.g., 31 Coffee and Tea

Attribute.Name: Food harvesting process
Attribute.Description: A harvesting process is a process which takes in some food material from an individual or community of plant or animal organisms in a given context and time, and outputs a precursor or consumable food product. This may include a part of an organism or the whole, and may involve killing the organism

Attribute.Name: GISAID accession
Attribute.Description: The GISAID accession assigned to the sequence. GISAID Accession Numbers are used as unique and permanent identifiers for each virus beginning with the letters EPI and followed by numbers, to identify viruses and/or segments; https://www.gisaid.org/; e.g., EPI_ISL_1091361

Attribute.Name: GISAID virus name
Attribute.Description: The full virus name submitted to GISAID (https://www.gisaid.org/), e.g., hCoV-19/Belgium/rega-3187/2021

Attribute.Name: HIV status
Attribute.Description: HIV status of subject, if yes HAART initiation status should also be indicated as [YES or NO]

Attribute.Name: Hazard Analysis Critical Control Points (HACCP) guide food safety term
Attribute.Description: Hazard Analysis Critical Control Points (HACCP) food safety terms; This field accepts terms listed under HACCP guide food safety term (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530221)
Attribute.Synonym: hazard analysis critical control points (haccp) guide food safety term

Attribute.Name: Interagency Food Safety Analytics Collaboration (IFSAC) category
Attribute.Description: The IFSAC food categorization scheme has five distinct levels to which foods can be assigned, depending upon the type of food. First, foods are assigned to one of four food groups (aquatic animals, land animals, plants, and other). Food groups include increasingly specific food categories; dairy, eggs, meat and poultry, and game are in the land animal food group, and the category meat and poultry is further subdivided into more specific categories of meat (beef, pork, other meat) and poultry (chicken, turkey, other poultry). Finally, foods are differentiated by differences in food processing (such as pasteurized fluid dairy products, unpasteurized fluid dairy products, pasteurized solid and semi-solid dairy products, and unpasteurized solid and semi-solid dairy products. An IFSAC food category chart is available from https://www.cdc.gov/foodsafety/ifsac/projects/food-categorization-scheme.html PMID: 28926300, e.g., Plants:Produce:Vegetables:Herbs:Dried Herbs
Attribute.Synonym: interagency food safety analytics collaboration (ifsac) category

Attribute.Name: NARMS isolate number
Attribute.Description: isolate identifier for the collection of isolates in the National Antimicrobial Resistance Monitoring System, authority http://www.cdc.gov/narms/about/index.html, e.g., CVM N6429

Attribute.Name: Omics Observatory ID
Attribute.Description: A unique identifier of the omics-enabled observatory (or comparable time series) your data derives from. This identifier should be provided by the OMICON ontology; if you require a new identifier for your time series, contact the ontology's developers. Information is available here: https://github.com/GLOMICON/omicon. This field is only applicable to records which derive from an omics time-series or observatory.

Attribute.Name: Population Description
Attribute.Description: The full, unabbreviated population descriptor from the Coriell Institute

Attribute.Name: SARS-CoV-2 diagnostic gene name 1
Attribute.Description: The name of the gene used in the first diagnostic SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR test.

Attribute.Name: SARS-CoV-2 diagnostic gene name 2
Attribute.Description: The name of the gene used in the second diagnostic SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR test.

Attribute.Name: SARS-CoV-2 diagnostic pcr Ct value 1
Attribute.Description: The cycle threshold (CT) value result from the first diagnostic SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR test, e.g., 21
Attribute.Synonym: sars cov 2 diag pcr ct value 1
sars cov 2 diagnostic pcr ct value 1

Attribute.Name: SARS-CoV-2 diagnostic pcr Ct value 2
Attribute.Description: The cycle threshold (CT) value result from the second diagnostic SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR test, e.g., 36
Attribute.Synonym: sars cov 2 diag pcr ct value 2
sars cov 2 diagnostic pcr ct value 2

Attribute.Name: Super Population Code
Attribute.Description: The 3 letter super population abbreviation from the Coriell Institute indicating ancestry

Attribute.Name: Super Population Description
Attribute.Description: The full, unabbreviated super population descriptor from the Coriell Institute

Attribute.Name: absolute air humidity
Attribute.Description: actual mass of water vapor - mh20 - present in the air water vapor mixture

Attribute.Name: additional info
Attribute.Description: Information that doesn't fit anywhere else

Attribute.Name: address
Attribute.Description: The street name and building number where the sampling occurred

Attribute.Name: adjacent rooms
Attribute.Description: List of rooms (room number, room name) immediately adjacent to the sampling room

Attribute.Name: aerospace structure
Attribute.Description: Aerospace structures typically consist of thin plates with stiffeners for the external surfaces, bulkheads and frames to support the shape and fasteners such as welds, rivets, screws and bolts to hold the components together, e.g., plane, glider

Attribute.Name: affection status
Attribute.Description: dbgap_public dictionary

Attribute.Name: age
Attribute.Description: age at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees

Attribute.Name: agrochemical additions
Attribute.Description: addition of fertilizers, pesticides, etc. - amount and time of applications

Attribute.Name: air particulate matter concentration
Attribute.Description: concentration of substances that remain suspended in the air, and comprise mixtures of organic and inorganic substances (PM10 and PM2.5); can report multiple PM's by entering numeric values preceded by name of PM

Attribute.Name: air temperature
Attribute.Description: temperature of the air at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: air temperature regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving an exposure to varying temperatures; should include the temperature, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include different temperature regimens

Attribute.Name: alkalinity
Attribute.Description: alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate

Attribute.Name: alkalinity method
Attribute.Description: Method used for alkalinity measurement

Attribute.Name: alkyl diethers
Attribute.Description: concentration of alkyl diethers

Attribute.Name: altitude
Attribute.Description: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.

Attribute.Name: aluminium saturation
Attribute.Description: aluminum saturation (esp. for tropical soils)

Attribute.Name: aluminium saturation method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining Al saturation

Attribute.Name: aminopeptidase activity
Attribute.Description: measurement of aminopeptidase activity

Attribute.Name: ammonium
Attribute.Description: concentration of ammonium

Attribute.Name: amniotic fluid color
Attribute.Description: specification of the color of the amniotic fluid sample

Attribute.Name: amount of light
Attribute.Description: The unit of illuminance and luminous emittance, measuring luminous flux per unit area

Attribute.Name: analyte type
Attribute.Description: dbgap_public dictionary

Attribute.Name: anamorph
Attribute.Description: Genus and species of the asexually reproducing stage of fungi - note that anamorph and teleomorph forms of the same taxon may have used taxonomic different names.

Attribute.Name: ancestral data
Attribute.Description: Information about either pedigree or other ancestral information description, e.g., parental variety in case of mutant or selection, A/3*B (meaning [(A x B) x B] x B)

Attribute.Name: animal environment
Attribute.Description: The environment from which the animal sample was taken, e.g., veterinary clinic

Attribute.Name: animal feeding equipment
Attribute.Description: Description of the feeding equipment used for livestock. This field accepts terms listed under feed delivery (http://opendata.inra.fr/EOL/EOL_0001757). Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes

Attribute.Name: animal housing system
Attribute.Description: Description of the housing system of the livestock. This field encourages terms listed under terrestrial management housing system (http://opendata.inra.fr/EOL/EOL_0001605), e.g., pen [EOL:0001902]

Attribute.Name: animal intrusion near sample source
Attribute.Description: Identification of animals intruding on the sample or sample site including invertebrates (such as pests or pollinators) and vertebrates (such as wildlife or domesticated animals). This field encourages terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also encourages identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes, e.g., large flies

Attribute.Name: animal water delivery method
Attribute.Description: Description of the equipment or method used to distribute water to livestock. This field accepts terms listed under water delivery equipment (http://opendata.inra.fr/EOL/EOL_0001653). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes

Attribute.Name: annual and seasonal precipitation
Attribute.Description: mean annual and seasonal precipitation (mm)

Attribute.Name: annual and seasonal temperature
Attribute.Description: mean annual and seasonal temperature (oC)

Attribute.Name: antibiotic regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving antibiotic administration; should include the name of antibiotic, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple antibiotic regimens

Attribute.Name: antimicrobial name
Attribute.Description: The class(es) or name(s) (generic or brand) of the antimicrobial(s) given to the food animal within the last 30 days, e.g., tetracycline [CHEBI:27902]

Attribute.Name: antimicrobial phenotype of spike-in bacteria
Attribute.Description: Qualitative description of a microbial response to antimicrobial agents. Bacteria may be susceptible or resistant to a broad range of antibiotic drugs or drug classes, with several intermediate states or phases. This field accepts terms under antimicrobial phenotype (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ARO_3004299)
Attribute.Synonym: antimicrobial phenotype of spike in bacteria

Attribute.Name: antiviral treatment agent
Attribute.Description: What was the antiviral treatment agent?

Attribute.Name: architectural structure
Attribute.Description: An architectural structure is a human-made, free-standing, immobile outdoor construction, e.g., building, shed, home

Attribute.Name: area sampled size
Attribute.Description: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected

Attribute.Name: aromatics wt%
Attribute.Description: Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene (SARA) is an analysis method that divides crude oil components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene)

Attribute.Name: asphaltenes wt%
Attribute.Description: Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene (SARA) is an analysis method that divides crude oil components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene)

Attribute.Name: atmospheric data
Attribute.Description: measurement of atmospheric data; can include multiple data

Attribute.Name: authority
Attribute.Description: Authority for the species identification.

Attribute.Name: average daily occupancy
Attribute.Description: Daily average occupancy of room. Indicate the number of person(s) daily occupying the sampling room

Attribute.Name: average dew point
Attribute.Description: The average of dew point measures taken at the beginning of every hour over a 24 hour period on the sampling day

Attribute.Name: average temperature
Attribute.Description: The average of temperatures taken at the beginning of every hour over a 24 hour period on the sampling day

Attribute.Name: bacterial carbon production
Attribute.Description: measurement of bacterial carbon production

Attribute.Name: bacterial density
Attribute.Description: Number of bacteria in sample, as defined by bacteria density (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0000043)

Attribute.Name: bacterial production
Attribute.Description: bacterial production in the water column measured by isotope uptake

Attribute.Name: bacterial respiration
Attribute.Description: measurement of bacterial respiration in the water column

Attribute.Name: barometric pressure
Attribute.Description: force per unit area exerted against a surface by the weight of air above that surface

Attribute.Name: basin name
Attribute.Description: Name of the basin, e.g. Campos

Attribute.Name: bathroom count
Attribute.Description: The number of bathrooms in the building

Attribute.Name: bedroom count
Attribute.Description: The number of bedrooms in the building

Attribute.Name: benzene
Attribute.Description: Concentration of benzene in the sample

Attribute.Name: beta-lactamase family
Attribute.Description: Specify the beta-lactamase family for this gene.

Attribute.Name: biochemical oxygen demand
Attribute.Description: a measure of the relative oxygen-depletion effect of a waste contaminant

Attribute.Name: biocide administration
Attribute.Description: List of biocides (commercial name of product and supplier) and date of administration

Attribute.Name: biocide administration method
Attribute.Description: Method of biocide administration (dose, frequency, duration, time elapsed between last biociding and sampling), e.g., 150 mg/l; weekly; 4 hr; 3 days

Attribute.Name: biocide used
Attribute.Description: Substance intended for preventing, neutralizing, destroying, repelling, or mitigating the effects of any pest or microorganism; that inhibits the growth, reproduction, and activity of organisms, including fungal cells; decreases the number of fungi or pests present; deters microbial growth and degradation of other ingredients in the formulation. Indicate the biocide used on the location where the sample was taken. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes, e.g., Quaternary ammonium compound|SterBac

Attribute.Name: biological material
Attribute.Description: Identifier for the biological material from which the nucleic acid sequenced was obtained.

Attribute.Name: biological sample replicate
Attribute.Description: Measurements of biologically distinct samples that show biological variation

Attribute.Name: biological status
Attribute.Description: The level of genome modification, e.g., wild, natural, semi-natural, inbred line, breeder's line, hybrid, clonal selection, mutant

Attribute.Name: biomass
Attribute.Description: amount of biomass; should include the name for the part of biomass measured, e.g. microbial, total. can include multiple measurements

Attribute.Name: biomaterial provider
Attribute.Description: name and address of the lab or PI, or a culture collection identifier

Attribute.Name: biospecimen repository
Attribute.Description: dbgap_public dictionary

Attribute.Name: biospecimen repository sample id
Attribute.Description: dbgap_public dictionary

Attribute.Name: biotic regimen
Attribute.Description: Information about treatment(s) involving use of biotic factors, such as bacteria, viruses or fungi

Attribute.Name: biovar
Attribute.Description: A biovar is a variant prokaryotic strain that differs physiologically and/or biochemically from other strains in a particular species.

Attribute.Name: birth control
Attribute.Description: specification of birth control medication used

Attribute.Name: bishomohopanol
Attribute.Description: concentration of bishomohopanol

Attribute.Name: blood disorder
Attribute.Description: history of blood disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: blood pressure diastolic
Attribute.Description: resting diastolic blood pressure, measured as mm mercury

Attribute.Name: blood pressure systolic
Attribute.Description: resting systolic blood pressure, measured as mm mercury

Attribute.Name: body habitat
Attribute.Description: original body habitat where the sample was obtained from

Attribute.Name: body mass index
Attribute.Description: body mass index, calculated as weight/(height)squared

Attribute.Name: body product
Attribute.Description: substance produced by the body, e.g. stool, mucus, where the sample was obtained from

Attribute.Name: breed
Attribute.Description: breed name - chiefly used in domesticated animals or plants

Attribute.Name: broad-scale environmental context
Attribute.Description: Add terms that identify the major environment type(s) where your sample was collected. Recommend subclasses of biome [ENVO:00000428]. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes e.g.: mangrove biome [ENVO:01000181]|estuarine biome [ENVO:01000020]

Attribute.Name: bromide
Attribute.Description: concentration of bromide

Attribute.Name: building occupancy type
Attribute.Description: primary function for which a building or discrete part of a building is intended to be used
Attribute.Format: ['', 'office', 'market', 'restaurant', 'residence', 'school', 'residential', 'commercial', 'low rise', 'high rise', 'wood framed', 'health care', 'airport', 'sports complex', 'missing', 'not applicable', 'not collected', 'not provided', 'restricted access']

Attribute.Name: building setting
Attribute.Description: location (geography) where a building is set

Attribute.Name: built structure age
Attribute.Description: The age of the built structure since construction

Attribute.Name: built structure setting
Attribute.Description: The characterization of the location of the built structure as high or low human density, e.g., urban, rural

Attribute.Name: built structure type
Attribute.Description: A physical structure that is a body or assemblage of bodies in space to form a system capable of supporting loads

Attribute.Name: calcium
Attribute.Description: concentration of calcium

Attribute.Name: carbapenemase
Attribute.Description: Does the enzyme exhibit carbapenemase activity? If the enzyme does exhibit carbapenemase activity, the response should be "yes", otherwise "no."

Attribute.Name: carbon dioxide
Attribute.Description: carbon dioxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: carbon monoxide
Attribute.Description: carbon monoxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: carbon/nitrogen ratio
Attribute.Description: ratio of amount or concentrations of carbon to nitrogen

Attribute.Name: ceiling area
Attribute.Description: The area of the ceiling space within the room

Attribute.Name: ceiling condition
Attribute.Description: The physical condition of the ceiling at the time of sampling, e.g., new, visible wear, needs repair, damaged, rupture

Attribute.Name: ceiling finish material
Attribute.Description: The type of material used to finish a ceiling, e.g., drywall, mineral fibre, tiles, PVC, plasterboard, metal, fiberglass, stucco, mineral wool/calcium silicate, wood

Attribute.Name: ceiling signs of water/mold
Attribute.Description: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on the ceiling, e.g., presence of mold visible, no presence of mold visible

Attribute.Name: ceiling structure
Attribute.Description: The construction format of the ceiling, e.g., wood frame, concrete

Attribute.Name: ceiling texture
Attribute.Description: The feel, appearance, or consistency of a ceiling surface, e.g., crows feet, crows-foot stomp, double skip, hawk and trowel, knockdown, popcorn, orange peel, rosebud stomp, Santa-Fe texture, skip trowel, smooth, stomp knockdown, swirl

Attribute.Name: ceiling thermal mass
Attribute.Description: The ability of the ceiling to provide inertia against temperature fluctuations. Generally this means concrete that is exposed. A metal deck that supports a concrete slab will act thermally as long as it is exposed to room air flow

Attribute.Name: ceiling type
Attribute.Description: The type of ceiling according to the ceiling's appearance or construction, e.g., cathedral, dropped, concave, barrel-shaped, coffered, cove, stretched

Attribute.Name: cell line
Attribute.Description: Name of the cell line.

Attribute.Name: cell type
Attribute.Description: Type of cell of the sample or from which the sample was obtained.

Attribute.Name: chemical administration
Attribute.Description: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v1.72), please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44603

Attribute.Name: chemical mutagen
Attribute.Description: treatment involving use of mutagens; should include the name of mutagen, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple mutagen regimens

Attribute.Name: chemical oxygen demand
Attribute.Description: a measure of the relative oxygen-depletion effect of a waste contaminant

Attribute.Name: chemical treatment
Attribute.Description: List of chemical compounds administered upstream the sampling location where sampling occurred, e.g., glycols, H2S scavenger, corrosion and scale inhibitors, demulsifiers, and other production chemicals. The commercial name of the product and name of the supplier should be provided. The date of administration should also be included

Attribute.Name: chemical treatment method
Attribute.Description: Method of chemical administration, dose, frequency, duration, time elapsed between administration and sampling, e.g., 50 mg/l; twice a week; 1 hr; 0 days

Attribute.Name: child of
Attribute.Description: indicates parentage; only applicable to sexual organisms, for bacteria use 'derived from'

Attribute.Name: chloride
Attribute.Description: concentration of chloride

Attribute.Name: chlorophyll
Attribute.Description: concentration of chlorophyll

Attribute.Name: climate environment
Attribute.Description: treatment involving an exposure to a particular climate; can include multiple climates

Attribute.Name: clone
Attribute.Description: Name for the clone or subculture from which the sample was taken.

Attribute.Name: clone lib
Attribute.Description: Formal identifier that points to source institute and clone library identifier.

Attribute.Name: collected by
Attribute.Description: Name of persons or institute who collected the sample

Attribute.Name: collection date
Attribute.Description: the date on which the sample was collected; date/time ranges are supported by providing two dates from among the supported value formats, delimited by a forward-slash character; collection times are supported by adding "T", then the hour and minute after the date, and must be in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), otherwise known as "Zulu Time" (Z); supported formats include "DD-Mmm-YYYY", "Mmm-YYYY", "YYYY" or ISO 8601 standard "YYYY-mm-dd", "YYYY-mm", "YYYY-mm-ddThh:mm:ss"; e.g., 30-Oct-1990, Oct-1990, 1990, 1990-10-30, 1990-10, 21-Oct-1952/15-Feb-1953, 2015-10-11T17:53:03Z; valid non-ISO dates will be automatically transformed to ISO format

Attribute.Name: collection device
Attribute.Description: Instrument or container used to collect sample, e.g., swab

Attribute.Name: collection method
Attribute.Description: Process used to collect the sample, e.g., bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL)

Attribute.Name: collection site geographic feature
Attribute.Description: Text or terms that describe the geographic feature where the food sample was obtained by the researcher. This field encourages selected terms listed under the following ontologies: anthropogenic geographic feature (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000002), for example agricultural fairground [ENVO:01000986]; garden [ENVO:00000011} or any of its subclasses; market [ENVO:01000987]; water well [ENVO:01000002]; or human construction (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000070), e.g., grocery store [GENEPIO:0001020]

Attribute.Name: component organism
Attribute.Description: a component organism of the mixed sample; use the full taxonomic name, eg, "Bordetella pertussis"

Attribute.Name: conductivity
Attribute.Description: electrical conductivity of water

Attribute.Name: cooling system identifier
Attribute.Description: The cooling system identifier

Attribute.Name: corrosion rate at sample location
Attribute.Description: Metal corrosion rate is the speed of metal deterioration due to environmental conditions. As environmental conditions change corrosion rates change accordingly. Therefore, long term corrosion rates are generally more informative than short term rates and for that reason they are preferred during reporting. In the case of suspected MIC, corrosion rate measurements at the time of sampling might provide insights into the involvement of certain microbial community members in MIC as well as potential microbial interplays

Attribute.Name: crop rotation
Attribute.Description: whether or not crop is rotated, and if yes, rotation schedule

Attribute.Name: crop yield
Attribute.Description: Amount of crop produced per unit or area of land

Attribute.Name: cultivar
Attribute.Description: cultivar name - cultivated variety of plant

Attribute.Name: culture collection
Attribute.Description: Name of source institute and unique culture identifier. See the description for the proper format and list of allowed institutes, http://www.insdc.org/controlled-vocabulary-culturecollection-qualifier

Attribute.Name: culture isolation date
Attribute.Description: A culture isolation date is a date-time entity marking the end of a process in which a sample yields a positive result for the target microbial analyte(s) in the form of an isolated colony or colonies, e.g., 5/24/2020

Attribute.Name: culture result
Attribute.Description: Any result of a bacterial culture experiment reported as a binary assessment, e.g., absent, active, inactive, negative, no, present, positive, yes

Attribute.Name: culture result organism
Attribute.Description: Taxonomic information about the cultured organism(s)

Attribute.Name: culture rooting medium
Attribute.Description: Name or reference for the hydroponic or in vitro culture rooting medium; can be the name of a commonly used medium or reference to a specific medium, e.g., Murashige and Skoog medium. If the medium has not been formally published, use the rooting medium descriptors

Attribute.Name: culture target microbial analyte
Attribute.Description: The target microbial analyte in terms of investigation scope. This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy

Attribute.Name: current land use
Attribute.Description: present state of sample site
Attribute.Format: ['', 'cities', 'farmstead', 'industrial areas', 'roads/railroads', 'rock', 'sand', 'gravel', 'mudflats', 'salt flats', 'badlands', 'permanent snow or ice', 'saline seeps', 'mines/quarries', 'oil waste areas', 'small grains', 'row crops', 'vegetable crops', 'horticultural plants (e.g. tulips)', 'marshlands (grass,sedges,rushes)', 'tundra (mosses,lichens)', 'rangeland', 'pastureland (grasslands used for livestock grazing)', 'hayland', 'meadows (grasses,alfalfa,fescue,bromegrass,timothy)', 'shrub land (e.g. mesquite,sage-brush,creosote bush,shrub oak,eucalyptus)', 'successional shrub land (tree saplings,hazels,sumacs,chokecherry,shrub dogwoods,blackberries)', 'shrub crops (blueberries,nursery ornamentals,filberts)', 'vine crops (grapes)', 'conifers (e.g. pine,spruce,fir,cypress)', 'hardwoods (e.g. oak,hickory,elm,aspen)', 'intermixed hardwood and conifers', 'tropical (e.g. mangrove,palms)', 'rainforest (evergreen forest receiving >406 cm annual rainfall)', 'swamp (permanent or semi-permanent water body dominated by woody plants)', 'crop trees (nuts,fruit,christmas trees,nursery trees)']

Attribute.Name: current vegetation
Attribute.Description: vegetation classification from one or more standard classification systems, or agricultural crop

Attribute.Name: current vegetation method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in vegetation classification

Attribute.Name: date last rain
Attribute.Description: The date of the last time it rained

Attribute.Name: date of SARS-CoV-2 vaccination
Attribute.Description: Date of the 1st dose of the SARS-CoV-2 vaccine, e.g., 2021-03-30

Attribute.Name: date of prior SARS-CoV-2 antiviral treatment
Attribute.Description: Date of the SARS-CoV-2 antiviral treatment, e.g., 2021-03-30
Attribute.Synonym: date of prior sars cov 2 antiviral treatment

Attribute.Name: date of prior SARS-CoV-2 infection
Attribute.Description: Date of the prior SARS-CoV-2 infection, e.g., 2021-03-30
Attribute.Synonym: date of prior sars cov 2 infection

Attribute.Name: degree of plant part maturity
Attribute.Description: A description of the stage of development of a plant or plant part based on maturity or ripeness. This field accepts terms listed under degree of plant maturity (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530050)

Attribute.Name: density
Attribute.Description: density of sample

Attribute.Name: depositional environment
Attribute.Description: Main depositional environment (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Depositional_environment), e.g., continental - alluvial, continental - aeolian, continental - fluvial, continental - lacustrine, transitional - deltaic, transitional - tidal, transitional - lagoonal, transitional - beach, transitional - lake, marine - shallow, marine - deep, marine - reef, other - evaporite, other - glacial, other - volcanic

Attribute.Name: depth
Attribute.Description: Depth is defined as the vertical distance below surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectivly. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.

Attribute.Name: depth (TVDSS) of hydrocarbon resource pressure
Attribute.Description: True vertical depth subsea (TVDSS) of the hydrocarbon resource where the original pressure was measured, e.g., 1578 m

Attribute.Name: depth (TVDSS) of hydrocarbon resource temperature
Attribute.Description: True vertical depth subsea (TVDSS) of the hydrocarbon resource where the original temperature was measured, e.g., 1345 m

Attribute.Name: derived from
Attribute.Description: indicates where one BioSample was derived from another BioSample

Attribute.Name: dermatology disorder
Attribute.Description: history of dermatology disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: design, construction, and operation documents
Attribute.Description: The building design, construction and operation documents, e.g., building information model, commissioning report, complaint logs, contract administration, cost estimate, janitorial schedules or logs, maintenance plans, schedule, sections, shop drawings, submittals, ventilation system, windows

Attribute.Name: development stage
Attribute.Description: Developmental stage at the time of sampling.

Attribute.Name: dew point
Attribute.Description: temperature to which a given parcel of humid air must be cooled, at constant barometric pressure, for water vapor to condense into water.

Attribute.Name: dietary claim or use
Attribute.Description: These descriptors are used either for foods intended for special dietary use as defined in 21 CFR 105 or for foods that have special characteristics indicated in the name or labeling. This field accepts terms listed under dietary claim or use (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03510023). Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes, but please consider limiting this list to the most prominent dietary claim or use

Attribute.Name: diether lipids
Attribute.Description: concentration of diether lipids; can include multiple types of diether lipids

Attribute.Name: disease
Attribute.Description: list of diseases diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. the value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from DO (Disease Ontology), free text for non-human. For DO terms, please see http://gemina.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/gemina/trunk/Gemina/ontologies/gemina_symptom.obo?view=log

Attribute.Name: disease stage
Attribute.Description: stage of disease at the time of sampling.

Attribute.Name: dissolved carbon dioxide
Attribute.Description: concentration of dissolved carbon dioxide

Attribute.Name: dissolved hydrogen
Attribute.Description: concentration of dissolved hydrogen

Attribute.Name: dissolved inorganic carbon
Attribute.Description: dissolved inorganic carbon concentration

Attribute.Name: dissolved inorganic nitrogen
Attribute.Description: concentration of dissolved inorganic nitrogen

Attribute.Name: dissolved inorganic phosphorus
Attribute.Description: concentration of dissolved inorganic phosphorus

Attribute.Name: dissolved iron
Attribute.Description: Concentration of dissolved iron in the sample

Attribute.Name: dissolved organic carbon
Attribute.Description: concentration of dissolved organic carbon

Attribute.Name: dissolved organic nitrogen
Attribute.Description: dissolved organic nitrogen concentration measured as; total dissolved nitrogen - NH4 - NO3 - NO2

Attribute.Name: dissolved oxygen
Attribute.Description: concentration of dissolved oxygen

Attribute.Name: dissolved oxygen in fluids
Attribute.Description: Concentration of dissolved oxygen in the oil field produced fluids as it contributes to oxgen-corrosion and microbial activity, e.g. Mic

Attribute.Name: dominant hand
Attribute.Description: dominant hand of the subject

Attribute.Name: door area or size
Attribute.Description: The size of the door

Attribute.Name: door condition
Attribute.Description: The physical condition of the door, e.g., damaged, needs repair, new, rupture, visible wear

Attribute.Name: door direction of opening
Attribute.Description: The direction the door opens, e.g., inward, outward, sideways

Attribute.Name: door location
Attribute.Description: The relative location of the door in the room, e.g., north, south, east, west

Attribute.Name: door material
Attribute.Description: The material the door is composed of, e.g., aluminum, cellular PVC, engineered plastic, fiberboard, fiberglass, metal, thermoplastic alloy, vinyl, wood, wood/plastic composite

Attribute.Name: door movement
Attribute.Description: The type of movement of the door, e.g., collapsible, folding, revolving, rolling shutter, sliding, swinging

Attribute.Name: door signs of water/mold
Attribute.Description: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on a door, e.g., presence of mold visible, no presence of mold visible

Attribute.Name: door type
Attribute.Description: The type of door material, e.g., composite, metal, wooden

Attribute.Name: door type, composite
Attribute.Description: The composite type of the door, e.g., metal covered, revolving, sliding, telescopic

Attribute.Name: door type, metal
Attribute.Description: The type of metal door, e.g., collapsible, corrugated steel, hollow, rolling shutters, steel plate

Attribute.Name: door type, wood
Attribute.Description: The type of wood door, e.g., bettened and ledged, battened, ledged and braced, battened, ledged and framed, battened, ledged, braced and frame, framed and paneled, glashed or sash, flush, louvered, wire gauged

Attribute.Name: douche
Attribute.Description: date of most recent douche

Attribute.Name: downward PAR
Attribute.Description: visible waveband radiance and irradiance measurements in the water column

Attribute.Name: drainage classification
Attribute.Description: drainage classification from a standard system such as the USDA system

Attribute.Name: drawings
Attribute.Description: The buildings architectural drawings, e.g., operation, as built, construction, bid, design, building navigation map, diagram, sketch

Attribute.Name: drug usage
Attribute.Description: any drug used by subject and the frequency of usage; can include multiple drugs used

Attribute.Name: dry mass
Attribute.Description: measurement of dry mass

Attribute.Name: duration of association with the host
Attribute.Description: Time spent in host of the symbiotic organism at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on symbiotic organism and study

Attribute.Name: ecotype
Attribute.Description: a population within a given species displaying genetically based, phenotypic traits that reflect adaptation to a local habitat, e.g., Columbia

Attribute.Name: efficiency percent
Attribute.Description: percentage of volatile solids removed from the anaerobic digestor

Attribute.Name: elevation
Attribute.Description: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.

Attribute.Name: elevator count
Attribute.Description: The number of elevators within the built structure

Attribute.Name: emulsions
Attribute.Description: amount or concentration of substances such as paints, adhesives, mayonnaise, hair colorants, emulsified oils, etc.; can include multiple emulsion types

Attribute.Name: encoded traits
Attribute.Description: Traits like antibiotic resistance/xenobiotic degration phenotypes/converting phage genes

Attribute.Name: enrichment protocol
Attribute.Description: The microbiological workflow or protocol followed to test for the presence or enumeration of the target microbial analyte(s). Please provide a PubMed or DOI reference for published protocols

Attribute.Name: environment adjacent to site
Attribute.Description: Description of the environmental system or features that are adjacent to the sampling site. This field accepts terms under ecosystem (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_01001110) and human construction (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000070). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes

Attribute.Name: environmental feature adjacent water source
Attribute.Description: Description of the environmental features that are adjacent to the farm water source. This field accepts terms under ecosystem (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_01001110) and human construction (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000070). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes

Attribute.Name: environmental medium
Attribute.Description: Add terms that identify the material displaced by the entity at time of sampling. Recommend subclasses of environmental material [ENVO:00010483]. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes e.g.: estuarine water [ENVO:01000301]|estuarine mud [ENVO:00002160]

Attribute.Name: environmental package
Attribute.Description: MIGS/MIMS/MIENS extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from one or more of the environments where the sample was obtained. All environmental packages listed here are further defined in separate subtables. By giving the name of the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from the subtables and can be reported

Attribute.Name: equipment shared with other farms
Attribute.Description: List of planting, growing or harvesting equipment shared with other farms

Attribute.Name: escalator count
Attribute.Description: The number of escalators within the built structure

Attribute.Name: estimated size
Attribute.Description: Estimated size of genome

Attribute.Name: ethnicity
Attribute.Description: ethnicity of the subject

Attribute.Name: ethylbenzene
Attribute.Description: Concentration of ethylbenzene in the sample

Attribute.Name: experimental factor
Attribute.Description: Variable aspect of experimental design

Attribute.Name: exposed ductwork
Attribute.Description: The amount of exposed ductwork in the room

Attribute.Name: exposed pipes
Attribute.Description: The number of exposed pipes in the room

Attribute.Name: exposure event
Attribute.Description: Event leading to exposure, e.g., mass gathering

Attribute.Name: exterior door count
Attribute.Description: The number of exterior doors in the built structure

Attribute.Name: extrachromosomal elements
Attribute.Description: Plasmids that have significance phenotypic consequence

Attribute.Name: extreme event
Attribute.Description: unusual physical events that may have affected microbial populations

Attribute.Name: extreme salinity
Attribute.Description: measured salinity

Attribute.Name: extreme weather date
Attribute.Description: Date of unusual weather events that may have affected microbial populations. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes, listed in reverse chronological order

Attribute.Name: extreme weather event
Attribute.Description: Unusual weather events that may have affected microbial populations. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes, listed in reverse chronological order, e.g., hail

Attribute.Name: facility type
Attribute.Description: Establishment details about the type of facility where the sample was taken. This is independent of the specific product(s) within the facility, e.g., manufacturing-processing

Attribute.Name: family role
Attribute.Description: relationships to other samples in the same study; can include multiple relationships

Attribute.Name: farm equipment sanitization
Attribute.Description: Method used to sanitize growing and harvesting equipment including type and concentration of sanitizing solution and frequency of sanitization

Attribute.Name: farm equipment sanitization frequency
Attribute.Description: The number of times farm equipment is cleaned. Frequency of cleaning might be on a daily basis, weekly, monthly, quarterly or annually

Attribute.Name: farm equipment used
Attribute.Description: List of relevant equipment used for planting, fertilization, harvesting, irrigation, land levelling, residue management, weeding or transplanting during the growing season. This field encourages terms listed under agricultural implement (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/AGRO_00000416). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes, e.g., combine harvester [AGRO:00000473]

Attribute.Name: farm watering water source
Attribute.Description: Source of water used on the farm for irrigation of crops or watering of livestock, e.g., water well

Attribute.Name: fermentation chemical additives
Attribute.Description: Any chemicals that are added to the fermentation process to achieve the desired final product

Attribute.Name: fermentation chemical additives percentage
Attribute.Description: The amount of chemical added to the fermentation process

Attribute.Name: fermentation headspace oxygen
Attribute.Description: The amount of headspace oxygen in a fermentation vessel

Attribute.Name: fermentation medium
Attribute.Description: The growth medium used for the fermented food fermentation process, which supplies the required nutrients. Usually this includes a carbon and nitrogen source, water, micronutrients and chemical additives

Attribute.Name: fermentation pH
Attribute.Description: The pH of the fermented food fermentation process

Attribute.Name: fermentation relative humidity
Attribute.Description: The relative humidity of the fermented food fermentation process

Attribute.Name: fermentation temperature
Attribute.Description: The temperature of the fermented food fermentation process

Attribute.Name: fermentation time
Attribute.Description: The time duration of the fermented food fermentation process

Attribute.Name: fermentation vessel
Attribute.Description: The type of vessel used for containment of the fermentation

Attribute.Name: fertilizer administration
Attribute.Description: Type of fertilizer or amendment added to the soil or water for the purpose of improving substrate health and quality for plant growth. This field encourages terms listed under agronomic fertilizer (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/AGRO_00002062). Multiple terms may apply and can be separated by pipes, listing in reverse chronological order, e.g., fish emulsion [AGRO:00000082]

Attribute.Name: fertilizer administration date
Attribute.Description: Date of administration of soil amendment or fertilizer. Multiple terms may apply and can be separated by pipes, listing in reverse chronological order

Attribute.Name: fertilizer regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving the use of fertilizers; should include the name fertilizer, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple fertilizer regimens

Attribute.Name: fetal health status
Attribute.Description: specification of foetal health status, should also include abortion

Attribute.Name: field name
Attribute.Description: Name of the hydrocarbon field, e.g., Albacora

Attribute.Name: filter type
Attribute.Description: device which removes solid particulates or airborne molecular contaminants
Attribute.Format: ['', 'particulate air filter', 'chemical air filter', 'low-MERV pleated media', 'HEPA', 'electrostatic', 'gas-phase or ultraviolet air treatments', 'missing', 'not applicable', 'not collected', 'not provided', 'restricted access']

Attribute.Name: fire
Attribute.Description: historical and/or physical evidence of fire

Attribute.Name: fireplace type
Attribute.Description: A firebox with chimney, e.g., gas burning, wood burning

Attribute.Name: flooding
Attribute.Description: historical and/or physical evidence of flooding

Attribute.Name: floor age
Attribute.Description: The time period since installment of the carpet or flooring

Attribute.Name: floor area
Attribute.Description: The area of the floor space within the room

Attribute.Name: floor condition
Attribute.Description: The physical condition of the floor at the time of sampling, e.g., new, visible wear, needs repair, damaged, rupture

Attribute.Name: floor count
Attribute.Description: The number of floors in the building, including basements and mechanical penthouse

Attribute.Name: floor finish material
Attribute.Description: The floor covering type; the finished surface that is walked on, e.g., tile, wood strip or parquet, carpet, rug, laminate wood, lineoleum, vinyl composition tile, sheet vinyl, stone, bamboo, cork, terrazo, concrete, none;specify unfinished, sealed, clear finish, paint

Attribute.Name: floor signs of water/mold
Attribute.Description: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew in a room, e.g., mold odor, wet floor, water stains, wall discoloration, floor discoloration, ceiling discoloration, peeling paint or wallpaper, bulging walls, condensation

Attribute.Name: floor structure
Attribute.Description: Refers to the structural elements and subfloor upon which the finish flooring is installed, e.g., balcony, floating floor, glass floor, raised floor, sprung floor, wood-framed, concrete

Attribute.Name: floor thermal mass
Attribute.Description: The ability of the floor to provide inertia against temperature fluctuations

Attribute.Name: fluorescence
Attribute.Description: raw or converted fluorescence of water

Attribute.Name: food additive
Attribute.Description: A substance or substances added to food to maintain or improve safety and freshness, to improve or maintain nutritional value, or improve taste, texture and appearance. This field encourages terms listed under food additive (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03412972). Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes, but please consider limiting this list to the top 5 ingredients listed in order as on the food label. See also, https://www.fda.gov/food/food-ingredients-packaging/overview-food-ingredients-additives-colors, e.g., xanthan gum [FOODON:03413321]

Attribute.Name: food allergen labeling
Attribute.Description: A label indication that the product contains a recognized allergen. This field accepts terms listed under dietary claim or use (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03510213)

Attribute.Name: food animal antimicrobial duration
Attribute.Description: The duration of time (days) that the antimicrobial was administered to the food animal

Attribute.Name: food animal antimicrobial frequency
Attribute.Description: The frequency per day that the antimicrobial was adminstered to the food animal

Attribute.Name: food animal antimicrobial intended use
Attribute.Description: The prescribed intended use of or the condition treated by the antimicrobial given to the food animal by any route of administration

Attribute.Name: food animal antimicrobial route of administration
Attribute.Description: The route by which the antimicrobial is adminstered into the body of the food animal

Attribute.Name: food animal body condition
Attribute.Description: Body condition scoring is a production management tool used to evaluate overall health and nutritional needs of a food animal, e.g., normal, over conditioned, under conditioned

Attribute.Name: food animal group size
Attribute.Description: The number of food animals of the same species that are maintained together as a unit, i.e. a herd or flock, e.g., 80

Attribute.Name: food animal source diet
Attribute.Description: If the isolate is from a food animal, the type of diet eaten by the food animal. Please list the main food staple and the setting, if appropriate. For a list of acceptable animal feed terms or categories, please see http://www.feedipedia.org. Multiple terms may apply and can be separated by pipes. Food product for animal covers foods intended for consumption by domesticated animals. Consult http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03309997. If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the food type. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes. If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the food product type

Attribute.Name: food animal source sex category
Attribute.Description: The sex and reproductive status of the food animal, e.g., castrated female, castrated male, intact female, intact male

Attribute.Name: food cleaning process
Attribute.Description: The process of cleaning food to separate other environmental materials from the food source. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes, e.g., rinsed with water|scrubbed with brush

Attribute.Name: food contact surface
Attribute.Description: The specific container or coating materials in direct contact with the food. Multiple values can be assigned. This field encourages terms listed under food contact surface (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03500010), e.g., aluminum surface [FOODON:03500042]

Attribute.Name: food container or wrapping
Attribute.Description: Type of container or wrapping defined by the main container material, the container form, and the material of the liner lids or ends. Also type of container or wrapping by form; prefer description by material first, then by form. This field encourages terms listed under food container or wrapping (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03490100), e.g., bottle or jar [FOODON:03490203]

Attribute.Name: food cooking process
Attribute.Description: The transformation of raw food by the application of heat. This field encourages terms listed under food cooking (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03450002), e.g., food blanching [FOODON:03470175]

Attribute.Name: food distribution point geographic location
Attribute.Description: A reference to a place on the Earth, by its name or by its geographical location that refers to a distribution point along the food chain. This field accepts terms listed under geographic location (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GAZ_00000448). Reference: Adam Diamond, James Barham. Moving Food Along the Value Chain: Innovations in Regional Food Distribution. U.S. Dept. of Agriculture, Agricultural Marketing Service. Washington, DC. March 2012. http://dx.doi.org/10.9752/MS045.03-2012

Attribute.Name: food distribution point geographic location (city)
Attribute.Description: A reference to a place on the Earth, by its name or by its geographical location that refers to a distribution point along the food chain. This field accepts terms listed under geographic location (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GAZ_00000448). Reference: Adam Diamond, James Barham. Moving Food Along the Value Chain: Innovations in Regional Food Distribution. U.S. Dept. of Agriculture, Agricultural Marketing Service. Washington, DC. March 2012. http://dx.doi.org/10.9752/MS045.03-2012

Attribute.Name: food ingredient
Attribute.Description: In this field, please list individual ingredients for multi-component food [FOODON:00002501] and simple foods that is not captured in food_type. Please use terms that are present in FoodOn. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes, but please consider limiting this list to the top 5 ingredients listed in order as on the food label. See also, https://www.fda.gov/food/food-ingredients-packaging/overview-food-ingredients-additives-colors

Attribute.Name: food package capacity
Attribute.Description: The maximum number of product units within a package

Attribute.Name: food packing integrity
Attribute.Description: A term label and term id to describe the state of the packing material and text to explain the exact condition. This field encourages terms listed under food packing medium integrity (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530218), e.g., food packing medium compromised [FOODON:00002517]

Attribute.Name: food packing medium
Attribute.Description: The medium in which the food is packed for preservation and handling or the medium surrounding homemade foods, e.g., peaches cooked in sugar syrup. The packing medium may provide a controlled environment for the food. It may also serve to improve palatability and consumer appeal. This includes edible packing media (e.g. fruit juice), gas other than air (e.g. carbon dioxide), vacuum packed, or packed with aerosol propellant. This field encourages terms under food packing medium (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03480020). Multiple terms may apply and can be separated by pipes, e.g., vacuum-packed [FOODON:03480027]

Attribute.Name: food preservation process
Attribute.Description: The methods contributing to the prevention or retardation of microbial, enzymatic or oxidative spoilage and thus to the extension of shelf life. This field encourages terms listed under food preservation process (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03470107), e.g., food fermentation [FOODON:00001304]

Attribute.Name: food processing method
Attribute.Description: Methods for processing food, e.g., food (blanched) [FOODON:00002767]

Attribute.Name: food product by quality
Attribute.Description: Descriptors for describing food visually or via other senses, which is useful for tasks like food inspection where little prior knowledge of how the food came to be is available. Some terms like "food (frozen)" are both a quality descriptor and the output of a process. This field accepts terms listed under food product by quality (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_00002454)

Attribute.Name: food product name legal status
Attribute.Description: A datum indicating that use of a food product name is regulated in some legal jurisdiction. This field accepts terms listed under food product name legal status (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530087)

Attribute.Name: food product origin geographic location
Attribute.Description: A reference to a place on the Earth, by its name or by its geographical location that describes the origin of the food commodity, either in terms of its cultivation or production. This field encourages terms listed under geographic location (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GAZ_00000448), e.g., Thailand

Attribute.Name: food product synonym
Attribute.Description: Other names by which the food product is known by (e.g., regional or non-English names), e.g., pinot gris

Attribute.Name: food product type
Attribute.Description: A food product type is a class of food products that is differentiated by its food composition (e.g., single- or multi-ingredient), processing and/or consumption characteristics. This does not include brand name products but it may include generic food dish categories. This field encourages terms under food product type (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON:03400361). For terms related to food product for an animal, consult food product for animal (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03309997). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the food type. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes, e.g., multi-component food product [FOODON:00002501]

Attribute.Name: food production characteristics
Attribute.Description: Descriptors of the food production system such as wild caught, free-range, organic, free-range, industrial, dairy, beef

Attribute.Name: food production environmental monitoring zone
Attribute.Description: An environmental monitoring zone is a formal designation as part of an environmental monitoring program, in which areas of a food production facility are categorized, commonly as zones 1-4, based on likelihood or risk of foodborne pathogen contamination. This field accepts entries of zones 1-4, e.g., Zone 1

Attribute.Name: food production system
Attribute.Description: Descriptors of the food production system or of the agricultural environment and growing conditions related to the farm production system. This field encourages terms listed under food production (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530206). Multiple terms may apply and can be separated by pipes, e.g., restaurant food preparation process [FOODON:03530110]

Attribute.Name: food quality date
Attribute.Description: The date recommended for the use of the product while at peak quality, this date is not a reflection of safety unless used on infant formula this date is not a reflection of safety and is typically labeled on a food product as ""best if used by,"" best by,"" ""use by,"" or ""freeze by"", e.g., 5/24/2020

Attribute.Name: food shipping transportation method
Attribute.Description: A descriptor for the method of movement of food commodity along the food distribution system. This field accepts terms listed under travel mode (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0001064). If the proper descrptor is not listed please use text to describe the mode of travel. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes

Attribute.Name: food shipping transportation vehicle
Attribute.Description: A descriptor for the mobile machine which is used to transport food commodities along the food distribution system. This field accepts terms listed under vehicle (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_01000604). If the proper descrptor is not listed please use text to describe the mode of travel. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes

Attribute.Name: food source
Attribute.Description: Individual organism or category of organisms from which the food product or its major ingredient is derived, e.g., giant tiger prawn [FOODON:03412612]

Attribute.Name: food source age
Attribute.Description: The age of the food source host organim. Depending on the type of host organism, age may be more appropriate to report in days, weeks, or years

Attribute.Name: food stored by consumer (storage duration)
Attribute.Description: The storage duration of the food commodity by the consumer, prior to onset of illness or sample collection. Indicate the timepoint written in ISO 8601 format

Attribute.Name: food stored by consumer (storage temperature)
Attribute.Description: Temperature at which food commodity was stored by the consumer, prior to onset of illness or sample collection

Attribute.Name: food traceability list category
Attribute.Description: The FDA is proposing to establish additional traceability recordkeeping requirements (beyond what is already required in existing regulations) for persons who manufacture, process, pack, or hold foods the Agency has designated for inclusion on the Food Traceability List. The Food Traceability List (FTL) identifies the foods for which the additional traceability records described in the proposed rule would be required. The term ""Food Traceability List"" (FTL) refers not only to the foods specifically listed (https://www.fda.gov/media/142303/download), but also to any foods that contain listed foods as ingredients, e.g., tropical tree fruits

Attribute.Name: food treatment process
Attribute.Description: Used to specifically characterize a food product based on the treatment or processes applied to the product or any indexed ingredient. The processes include adding, substituting or removing components or modifying the food or component, e.g., through fermentation. Multiple values can be assigned. This fields accepts terms listed under food treatment process (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03460111)

Attribute.Name: food type processed in facility
Attribute.Description: Food type processed in facility, e.g., dairy

Attribute.Name: forma
Attribute.Description: Taxonomy level below subspecies (or variety in botany). Use is similar to ecotype etc.

Attribute.Name: forma specialis
Attribute.Description: Usually applied to fungus adapted to a specific host.

Attribute.Name: formation water salinity
Attribute.Description: Original formation water salinity (prior to secondary recovery e.g. Waterflooding) expressed as TDS

Attribute.Name: frequency of cleaning
Attribute.Description: The number of times the sample location is cleaned, e.g., daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, annually

Attribute.Name: frequency of cooking
Attribute.Description: The number of times a meal is cooked per week

Attribute.Name: fungicide regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving use of fungicides; should include the name of fungicide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple fungicide regimens

Attribute.Name: furniture
Attribute.Description: The types of furniture present in the sampled room, e.g., cabinet, chair, desks

Attribute.Name: gap accession
Attribute.Description: technical dictionary

Attribute.Name: gap change status
Attribute.Description: technical dictionary

Attribute.Name: gap consent code
Attribute.Description: technical dictionary

Attribute.Name: gap consent short name
Attribute.Description: technical dictionary

Attribute.Name: gap sample id
Attribute.Description: technical dictionary

Attribute.Name: gap study version
Attribute.Description: technical dictionary

Attribute.Name: gap subject id
Attribute.Description: technical dictionary

Attribute.Name: gaseous environment
Attribute.Description: use of conditions with differing gaseous environments; should include the name of gaseous compound, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple gaseous environment regimens

Attribute.Name: gaseous substances
Attribute.Description: amount or concentration of substances such as hydrogen sulfide, carbon dioxide, methane, etc.; can include multiple substances

Attribute.Name: gastrointestinal tract disorder
Attribute.Description: history of gastrointestinal tract disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: gender of restroom
Attribute.Description: The gender type of the restroom, e.g., all gender, female, gender neutral, male, male and female, unisex

Attribute.Name: genetic modification
Attribute.Description: Genetic modifications of the genome of an organism, which may occur naturally by spontaneous mutation, or be introduced by some experimental means, e.g. specification of a transgene or the gene knocked-out or details of transient transfection

Attribute.Name: genotype
Attribute.Description: observed genotype

Attribute.Name: geo loc exposure
Attribute.Description: The country where the host was likely exposed to the causative agent of the illness. This location pertains to the country the host was believed to be exposed, and may not be the same as the host's country of residence, e.g., Canada

Attribute.Name: geographic location
Attribute.Description: Geographical origin of the sample; use the appropriate name from this list http://www.insdc.org/documents/country-qualifier-vocabulary. Use a colon to separate the country or ocean from more detailed information about the location, eg "Canada: Vancouver" or "Germany: halfway down Zugspitze, Alps"
Attribute.Synonym: geographic location country and or sea

Attribute.Name: gestation state
Attribute.Description: specification of the gestation state

Attribute.Name: glucosidase activity
Attribute.Description: measurement of glucosidase activity

Attribute.Name: gravidity
Attribute.Description: whether or not subject is gravid, and if yes date due or date post-conception, specifying which is used

Attribute.Name: gravity
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving use of gravity factor to study various types of responses in presence, absence or modified levels of gravity; can include multiple treatments

Attribute.Name: growth facility
Attribute.Description: Type of facility where the sampled plant was grown; controlled vocabulary: growth chamber, open top chamber, glasshouse, experimental garden, field. Alternatively use Crop Ontology (CO) terms, see http://www.cropontology.org/ontology/CO_715/Crop%20Research

Attribute.Name: growth habit
Attribute.Description: Characteristic shape, appearance or growth form of a plant species, e.g., erect, semi-erect, spreading, prostrate

Attribute.Name: growth hormone regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of growth hormone, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple growth hormone regimens

Attribute.Name: growth media
Attribute.Description: information about growth media for growing the plants or tissue cultured samples

Attribute.Name: growth medium
Attribute.Description: A liquid or gel containing nutrients, salts, and other factors formulated to support the growth of microorganisms, cells, or plants (National Cancer Institute Thesaurus). The name of the medium used to grow the microorganism

Attribute.Name: gynecological disorder
Attribute.Description: history of gynecological disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: hallway/corridor count
Attribute.Description: The total count of hallways and cooridors in the built structure

Attribute.Name: handidness
Attribute.Description: The handidness of the individual sampled, e.g., ambidexterity, left handedness, mixed-handedness, right handedness

Attribute.Name: haplotype
Attribute.Description: Name of the haplotype. Primarily used for identification. A combination of alleles at multiple loci on the same chromosome that are closely linked and tend to be inherited as a unit.

Attribute.Name: health state
Attribute.Description: Health or disease status of sample at time of collection

Attribute.Name: heating and cooling system type
Attribute.Description: methods of conditioning or heating a room or building
Attribute.Format: ['', 'radiant system', 'heat pump', 'forced air system', 'steam forced heat', 'wood stove', 'missing', 'not applicable', 'not collected', 'not provided', 'restricted access']

Attribute.Name: heating delivery locations
Attribute.Description: The location of heat delivery within the room, e.g., north, south, east, west

Attribute.Name: heating system delivery method
Attribute.Description: The method by which the heat is delivered through the system, e.g., conductive, radiant

Attribute.Name: heating system identifier
Attribute.Description: The heating system identifier

Attribute.Name: heavy metals
Attribute.Description: heavy metals present and concentrationsany drug used by subject and the frequency of usage; can include multiple heavy metals and concentrations

Attribute.Name: heavy metals method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining heavy metals

Attribute.Name: height carpet fiber mat
Attribute.Description: The average carpet fiber height in the indoor environment

Attribute.Name: height or length
Attribute.Description: measurement of height or length

Attribute.Name: herbicide regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving use of herbicides; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of herbicide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple regimens

Attribute.Name: histological type
Attribute.Description: dbgap_public dictionary

Attribute.Name: horizon method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining the horizon

Attribute.Name: host
Attribute.Description: The natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which the sample was obtained. Use the full taxonomic name, eg, "Homo sapiens".

Attribute.Name: host HIV status
Attribute.Description: HIV status of subject, if yes HAART initiation status should also be indicated as [YES or NO]

Attribute.Name: host age
Attribute.Description: Age of host at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: host anatomical material
Attribute.Description: Host anatomical material or substance produced by the body where the sample was obtained, e.g., stool, mucus, saliva

Attribute.Name: host anatomical part
Attribute.Description: Anatomical part of the host organism (e.g. tissue) that was sampled, e.g., nasopharynx

Attribute.Name: host animal breed
Attribute.Description: The animal breed of the host organism. Used mainly for animal hosts, e.g., duroc, angus, mixed breed

Attribute.Name: host blood pressure diastolic
Attribute.Description: resting diastolic blood pressureof the host, measured as mm mercury

Attribute.Name: host blood pressure systolic
Attribute.Description: resting systolic blood pressure of the host, measured as mm mercury

Attribute.Name: host body habitat
Attribute.Description: original body habitat where the sample was obtained from

Attribute.Name: host body mass index
Attribute.Description: body mass index of the host, calculated as weight/(height)squared

Attribute.Name: host body product
Attribute.Description: substance produced by the host, e.g. stool, mucus, where the sample was obtained from

Attribute.Name: host body temperature
Attribute.Description: core body temperature of the host when sample was collected

Attribute.Name: host cellular location
Attribute.Description: The localization of the symbiotic host organism within the host from which it was sampled, e.g., intracellular, extracellular

Attribute.Name: host color
Attribute.Description: the color of host

Attribute.Name: host common name
Attribute.Description: The natural language (non-taxonomic) name of the host organism, e.g., mouse

Attribute.Name: host dependence
Attribute.Description: Type of host dependence for the symbiotic host organism to its host., e.g., facultative, obligate

Attribute.Name: host description
Attribute.Description: Additional information not included in other defined vocabulary fields

Attribute.Name: host diet
Attribute.Description: type of diet depending on the sample for animals omnivore, herbivore etc., for humans high-fat, meditteranean etc.; can include multiple diet types

Attribute.Name: host disease
Attribute.Description: Name of relevant disease, e.g. Salmonella gastroenteritis. Controlled vocabulary, http://bioportal.bioontology.org/ontologies/1009 or http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/mesh

Attribute.Name: host disease outcome
Attribute.Description: Final outcome of disease, e.g., death, chronic disease, recovery

Attribute.Name: host disease stage
Attribute.Description: Stage of disease at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: host dry mass
Attribute.Description: measurement of dry mass

Attribute.Name: host growth conditions
Attribute.Description: literature reference giving growth conditions of the host

Attribute.Name: host health state
Attribute.Description: Information regarding health state of the individual sampled at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: host height
Attribute.Description: the height of subject

Attribute.Name: host infra specific name
Attribute.Description: taxonomic information subspecies level

Attribute.Name: host infra specific rank
Attribute.Description: taxonomic rank information below subspecies level, such as variety, form, rank etc.

Attribute.Name: host last meal
Attribute.Description: content of last meal and time since feeding; can include multiple values

Attribute.Name: host length
Attribute.Description: the length of subject

Attribute.Name: host life stage
Attribute.Description: description of host life stage

Attribute.Name: host number individual
Attribute.Description: Number of symbiotic host individuals pooled at the time of collection

Attribute.Name: host occupation
Attribute.Description: most frequent job performed by subject

Attribute.Name: host of the symbiont role
Attribute.Description: Role of the host in the life cycle of the symbiotic organism, e.g., accidental, dead-end, definitive, intermediate, paratenic, reservoir, single host

Attribute.Name: host of the symbiotic host common name
Attribute.Description: Common name of the host of the symbiotic host organism

Attribute.Name: host of the symbiotic host disease status
Attribute.Description: List of diseases with which the host of the symbiotic host organism has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from the DO (Human Disease Ontology) at https://www.disease-ontology.org, non-human host diseases are free text

Attribute.Name: host of the symbiotic host environemental medium
Attribute.Description: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the symbiotic host organism at the time of sampling. This usually will be a tissue or substance type from the host, but may be another material if the symbiont is external to the host. We recommend using classes from the UBERON ontology, but subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483) may also be used. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS. Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g., air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g., intestines, heart)

Attribute.Name: host of the symbiotic host family relationship
Attribute.Description: Familial relationship of the host of the symbiotic host organisms to other hosts of symbiotic host organism in the same study; can include multiple relationships

Attribute.Name: host of the symbiotic host genotype
Attribute.Description: Observed genotype of the host of the symbiotic host organism

Attribute.Name: host of the symbiotic host gravidity
Attribute.Description: Whether or not the host of the symbiotic host organism is gravid, and if yes date due or date post-conception, specifying which is used

Attribute.Name: host of the symbiotic host infra-specific name
Attribute.Description: Taxonomic name information of the host of the symbiotic host organism below subspecies level
Attribute.Synonym: host of the symbiotic host infra specific name

Attribute.Name: host of the symbiotic host infra-specific rank
Attribute.Description: Taxonomic rank information about the host of the symbiotic host organism below subspecies level, such as variety, form, rank
Attribute.Synonym: host of the symbiotic host infra specific rank

Attribute.Name: host of the symbiotic host local environmental context
Attribute.Description: For a symbiotic host organism the local anatomical environment within its host may have causal influences. Report the anatomical entity(s) which are in the direct environment of the symbiotic host organism being sampled and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. For example, if the symbiotic host organism being sampled is an intestinal worm, its local environmental context will be the term for intestine from UBERON (http://uberon.github.io/)

Attribute.Name: host of the symbiotic host phenotype
Attribute.Description: Phenotype of the host of the symbiotic host organism. For phenotypic quality ontology (PATO) terms, see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/pato

Attribute.Name: host of the symbiotic host subject id
Attribute.Description: A unique identifier by which each host of the symbiotic host organism subject can be referred to, de-identified, e.g. #H14

Attribute.Name: host of the symbiotic host taxon id
Attribute.Description: NCBI taxon id of the host of the symbiotic host organism

Attribute.Name: host of the symbiotic host total mass
Attribute.Description: Total mass of the host of the symbiotic host organism at collection, the unit depends on the host

Attribute.Name: host pulse
Attribute.Description: resting pulse of the host, measured as beats per minute

Attribute.Name: host recent travel location
Attribute.Description: The name of the country that was the destination of most recent travel. Specify the countries (and more granular locations if known) travelled, e.g., United Kingdom. Can include multiple travels; separate multiple travel events with a semicolon.

Attribute.Name: host recent travel return date
Attribute.Description: The date of a person's most recent return to some residence from a journey originating at that residence, e.g., 2021-03-30

Attribute.Name: host sex
Attribute.Description: Gender or physical sex of the host
Attribute.Format: ['', 'male', 'female', 'pooled male and female', 'neuter', 'hermaphrodite', 'intersex', 'not determined', 'missing', 'not applicable', 'not collected', 'not provided', 'restricted access']

Attribute.Name: host shape
Attribute.Description: morphological shape of host

Attribute.Name: host specificity
Attribute.Description: Level of specificity of symbiont-host interaction, e.g., family-specific, generalist, genus-specific, species-specific
