Attribute.Name: host specimen voucher
Attribute.Description: Identifier for the physical specimen. Include a URI (Uniform Resource Identifier) in the form of a URL providing a direct link to the physical host specimen. If the specimen was destroyed in the process of analysis, electronic images (e-vouchers) are an adequate substitute for a physical host voucher specimen. If a URI is not available, a museum-provided globally unique identifier (GUID) can be used. URI example: http://portal.vertnet.org/o/fmnh/mammals?id=33e55cfe-330b-40d9-aaae-8d042cba7542; INSDC triplet example: UAM:Mamm:52179

Attribute.Name: host subject id
Attribute.Description: a unique identifier by which each subject can be referred to, de-identified, e.g. #131

Attribute.Name: host subspecific genetic lineage
Attribute.Description: Information about the genetic distinctness of the host organism below the subspecies level e.g., serovar, serotype, biotype, ecotype, variety, cultivar, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. Subspecies should not be recorded in this term, but in the NCBI taxonomy. Supply both the lineage name and the lineage rank separated by a colon, e.g., biovar:abc123

Attribute.Name: host substrate
Attribute.Description: the growth substrate of the host

Attribute.Name: host taxonomy ID
Attribute.Description: NCBI taxonomy ID of the host, e.g. 9606

Attribute.Name: host tissue sampled
Attribute.Description: name of body site where the sample was obtained from, such as a specific organ or tissue, e.g., tongue, lung. For foundational model of anatomy ontology (fma) (v 4.11.0) or Uber-anatomy ontology (UBERON) (v releases/2014-06-15) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/FMA or http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/UBERON

Attribute.Name: host total mass
Attribute.Description: total mass of the host at collection, the unit depends on host

Attribute.Name: host variety or cultivar
Attribute.Description: The variety or cultivar of the host organism; the name given to a particular variety of organism to distinguish it from otherwise similar organisms of the same species, e.g., romaine lettuce; Athena melons; Patio Snacker cucumbers

Attribute.Name: host wet mass
Attribute.Description: measurement of wet mass

Attribute.Name: hrt
Attribute.Description: whether subject had hormone replacement theraphy, and if yes start date

Attribute.Name: humidity
Attribute.Description: amount of water vapour in the air, at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: humidity regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving an exposure to varying degree of humidity; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include amount of humidity administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple regimens

Attribute.Name: hydrocarbon resource geological age
Attribute.Description: Geological age of hydrocarbon resource (additional info: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Period_(geology)), e.g., archean, cambrian, carboniferous, cenozoic, cretaceous, devonian, jurassic, mesozoic, neogene, ordovician, paleogene, paleozoic, permian, precambrian, proterozoic, silurian, triassic

Attribute.Name: hydrocarbon resource original pressure
Attribute.Description: Original pressure of the hydrocarbon resource

Attribute.Name: hydrocarbon resource original temperature
Attribute.Description: Original temperature of the hydrocarbon resource

Attribute.Name: hydrocarbon resource type
Attribute.Description: Main hydrocarbon resource type. The term Hydrocarbon Resource is defined as a natural environmental feature containing large amounts of hydrocarbons at high concentrations potentially suitable for commercial exploitation, e.g., oil reservoir, gas reservoir, oil sand, coalbed, shale, tight oil reservoir, tight gas reservoir

Attribute.Name: hydrocarbon type produced
Attribute.Description: Main hydrocarbon type produced from resource, e.g., oil, gas-condensate, gas, bitumen, coalbed methane

Attribute.Name: hygienic food production area
Attribute.Description: The subdivision of areas within a food production facility according to hygienic requirements. This field accepts terms listed under hygienic food production area (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO). Please add a term that most accurately indicates the hygienic area your sample was taken from according to the definitions provided

Attribute.Name: hysterectomy
Attribute.Description: specification of whether hysterectomy was performed

Attribute.Name: identified by
Attribute.Description: name of the taxonomist who identified the specimen

Attribute.Name: image file
Attribute.Description: technical dictionary

Attribute.Name: indoor sampling surface or structure subpart
Attribute.Description: The subpart of the object(s) that was swabbed, like a cart, drain, counter, etc., e.g., wheel

Attribute.Name: indoor space
Attribute.Description: a distinguishable space within a structure, the purpose for which discrete areas of a building is used

Attribute.Name: indoor surface
Attribute.Description: type of indoor surface
Attribute.Format: ['', 'counter top', 'window', 'wall', 'cabinet', 'ceiling', 'door', 'shelving', 'vent cover', 'missing', 'not applicable', 'not collected', 'not provided', 'restricted access']

Attribute.Name: industrial effluent percent
Attribute.Description: percentage of industrial effluents received by wastewater treatment plant

Attribute.Name: infra specific name
Attribute.Description: taxonomic information subspecies level

Attribute.Name: infra specific rank
Attribute.Description: taxonomic rank information below subspecies level, such as variety, form, rank etc.

Attribute.Name: injection water breakthrough date of specific well
Attribute.Description: Injection water breakthrough date per well following a secondary and/or tertiary recovery

Attribute.Name: injection water fraction
Attribute.Description: Proportion of the produced fluids derived from injected water at the time of sampling, e.g., 87%

Attribute.Name: inorganic particles
Attribute.Description: concentration of particles such as sand, grit, metal particles, ceramics, etc.; can include multiple particles

Attribute.Name: inside lux light
Attribute.Description: The recorded value at sampling time (power density)

Attribute.Name: intended consumer
Attribute.Description: Food consumer type, human or animal, for which the food product is produced and marketed, e.g., human
Attribute.Format: ['', 'human as food consumer', 'animal as food consumer', 'missing', 'not applicable', 'not collected', 'not provided', 'restricted access']

Attribute.Name: interior wall condition
Attribute.Description: The physical condition of the wall at the time of sampling, e.g., new, visible wear, needs repair, damaged, rupture

Attribute.Name: investigation type
Attribute.Description: Nucleic Acid Sequence Report is the root element of all MIGS/MIMS compliant reports as standardized by Genomic Standards Consortium. This field is either eukaryote,bacteria,virus,plasmid,organelle, metagenome, miens-survey or miens-culture

Attribute.Name: is tumor
Attribute.Description: dbgap_public dictionary

Attribute.Name: isolate
Attribute.Description: identification or description of the specific individual from which this sample was obtained

Attribute.Name: isolate name alias
Attribute.Description: Other IDs associated with this isolate or strain. Separate with '; ' if more than one

Attribute.Name: isolation and growth condition
Attribute.Description: PMID or url for isolation and growth condition specifications

Attribute.Name: isolation source
Attribute.Description: Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived.

Attribute.Name: kidney disorder
Attribute.Description: history of kidney disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: lab host
Attribute.Description: Scientific name and description of the laboratory host used to propagate the source organism or material from which the sample was obtained, e.g., Escherichia coli DH5a, or Homo sapiens HeLa cells

Attribute.Name: label
Attribute.Description: a label for sample, or name of an individual animal (e.g., Clint)

Attribute.Name: labeling claims
Attribute.Description: Descriptors of the food production system such as wild caught, free-range, organic, free-range, industrial, hormone-free, antibiotic free, cage free, e.g., wild caught

Attribute.Name: last time swept/mopped/vacuumed
Attribute.Description: The last time the floor was cleaned (swept, mopped, vacuumed)

Attribute.Name: latitude and longitude
Attribute.Description: The geographical coordinates of the location where the sample was collected. Specify as degrees latitude and longitude in format "d[d.dddd] N|S d[dd.dddd] W|E", eg, 38.98 N 77.11 W

Attribute.Name: life stage
Attribute.Description: description of life stage

Attribute.Name: light intensity
Attribute.Description: measurement of light intensity

Attribute.Name: light regimen
Attribute.Description: Information about treatment(s) involving exposure to light, including both light intensity and quality

Attribute.Name: light type
Attribute.Description: application of light to achieve some practical or aesthetic effect. Lighting includes the use of both artificial light sources such as lamps and light fixtures, as well as natural illumination by capturing daylight. Can also include absence of light
Attribute.Format: ['', 'natural light', 'electric light', 'no light', 'missing', 'not applicable', 'not collected', 'not provided', 'restricted access']

Attribute.Name: link to classification information
Attribute.Description: link to digitized soil maps or other soil classification information

Attribute.Name: link to climate information
Attribute.Description: link to climate resource

Attribute.Name: lithology
Attribute.Description: Hydrocarbon resource main lithology (Additional information: http://petrowiki.org/Lithology_and_rock_type_determination), e.g., basement, chalk, chert, coal, conglomerate, diatomite, dolomite, limestone, sandstone, shale, siltstone, volcanic

Attribute.Name: liver disorder
Attribute.Description: history of liver disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: local air flow impediments
Attribute.Description: Presence of objects in the area that would influence or impede air flow through the air filter, e.g., obstructed, unobstructed

Attribute.Name: local classification
Attribute.Description: soil classification based on local soil classification system

Attribute.Name: local classification method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining the local soil classification

Attribute.Name: local-scale environmental context
Attribute.Description: Add terms that identify environmental entities having causal influences upon the entity at time of sampling, multiple terms can be separated by pipes, e.g.: shoreline [ENVO:00000486]|intertidal zone [ENVO:00000316]

Attribute.Name: location or room in facility
Attribute.Description: Name of the location or room in the facility where the sampling occurred, e.g., ripening room

Attribute.Name: lot number
Attribute.Description: A distinctive alpha-numeric identification code assigned by the manufacturer or distributor to a specific quantity of manufactured material or product within a batch. The submitter should provide lot number of the item followed by the item name for which the lot number was provided

Attribute.Name: magnesium
Attribute.Description: concentration of magnesium

Attribute.Name: major diet change in last six months
Attribute.Description: specification of major diet changes in the last six months, if yes the change should be specified

Attribute.Name: material condition
Attribute.Description: Condition of material sampled, e.g., rusted

Attribute.Name: material of contact prior to food packaging
Attribute.Description: The material the food contacted (e.g., was processed in) prior to packaging. This field accepts terms listed under material of contact prior to food packaging (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530077). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the material of contact prior to food packaging

Attribute.Name: maternal health status
Attribute.Description: specification of the maternal health status

Attribute.Name: maximum occupancy
Attribute.Description: The maximum amount of people allowed in the indoor environment

Attribute.Name: mean annual precipitation
Attribute.Description: The average of all annual precipitation values known, or an estimated equivalent value derived by such methods as regional indexes or Isohyetal maps

Attribute.Name: mean annual temperature
Attribute.Description: Mean annual temperature

Attribute.Name: mean friction velocity
Attribute.Description: measurement of mean friction velocity

Attribute.Name: mean peak friction velocity
Attribute.Description: measurement of mean peak friction velocity

Attribute.Name: mean seasonal humidity
Attribute.Description: Average humidity of the region throughout the growing season

Attribute.Name: mean seasonal precipitation
Attribute.Description: The average of all seasonal precipitation values known, or an estimated equivalent value derived by such methods as regional indexes or Isohyetal maps

Attribute.Name: mean seasonal temperature
Attribute.Description: Mean seasonal temperature

Attribute.Name: mechanical damage
Attribute.Description: information about any mechanical damage exerted on the plant; can include multiple damages and sites

Attribute.Name: mechanical structure
Attribute.Description: Mechanical structure: a moving structure, e.g., subway, coach, carriage, elevator, escalator, boat, train, car, bus

Attribute.Name: medical history performed
Attribute.Description: whether full medical history was collected

Attribute.Name: medication code
Attribute.Description: can include multiple medication codes

Attribute.Name: menarche
Attribute.Description: date of most recent menstruation

Attribute.Name: menopause
Attribute.Description: date of onset of menopause

Attribute.Name: methane
Attribute.Description: methane (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: microbial biomass
Attribute.Description: the part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 µm. IF you keep this, you would need to have correction factors used for conversion to the final units, which should be mg C (or N)/kg soil).

Attribute.Name: microbial biomass method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining microbial biomass

Attribute.Name: microbial starter
Attribute.Description: Any type of microorganisms used in food production. This field accepts terms listed under live organisms for food production (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_0344453)

Attribute.Name: microbial starter NCBI taxonomy ID
Attribute.Description: Please include Genus species and strain ID, if known of microorganisms used in food production. For complex communities, pipes can be used to separate two or more microbes

Attribute.Name: microbial starter inoculation
Attribute.Description: The amount of starter culture used to inoculate a new batch

Attribute.Name: microbial starter organism count
Attribute.Description: Total cell count of starter culture per gram, volume or area of sample and the method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) should also be provided, e.g., total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qPCR

Attribute.Name: microbial starter preparation
Attribute.Description: Information about the protocol or method used to prepare the starter inoculum

Attribute.Name: microbial starter source
Attribute.Description: The source from which the microbial starter culture was sourced. If commercially supplied, list supplier

Attribute.Name: microbiological culture medium
Attribute.Description: A culture medium used to select for, grow, and maintain prokaryotic microorganisms. Can be in either liquid (broth) or solidified (e.g. with agar) forms. This field accepts terms listed under microbiological culture medium (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/MICRO_0000067). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the culture medium

Attribute.Name: mineral nutrient regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving the use of mineral supplements; should include the name of mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple mineral nutrient regimens

Attribute.Name: miscellaneous parameter
Attribute.Description: any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here

Attribute.Name: mode of transmission
Attribute.Description: The process through which the symbiotic host organism entered the host from which it was sampled, e.g., horizontal:castrator, horizontal:directly transmitted, horizontal:micropredator, horizontal:parasitoid, horizontal:trophically transmitted, horizontal:vector transmitted, vertical

Attribute.Name: molecular data type
Attribute.Description: Type of molecular (omics) data tied to this sample

Attribute.Name: n alkanes
Attribute.Description: concentration of n-alkanes; can include multiple n-alkanes

Attribute.Name: negative control type
Attribute.Description: The substance or equipment used as a negative control in an investigation, e.g., distilled water, phosphate buffer, empty collection device, empty collection tube, DNA-free PCR mix, sterile swab, sterile syringe

Attribute.Name: nitrate
Attribute.Description: concentration of nitrate

Attribute.Name: nitrite
Attribute.Description: concentration of nitrite

Attribute.Name: nitrogen
Attribute.Description: concentration of nitrogen (total)

Attribute.Name: non mineral nutrient regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving the exposure of plant to non-mineral nutrient such as oxygen, hydrogen or carbon; should include the name of non-mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple non-mineral nutrient regimens

Attribute.Name: nose throat disorder
Attribute.Description: history of nose-throat disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: nose/mouth/teeth/throat disorder
Attribute.Description: history of nose/mouth/teeth/throat disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: number of houseplants
Attribute.Description: The number of plant(s) in the sampling space

Attribute.Name: number of pets
Attribute.Description: The number of pets residing in the sampled space

Attribute.Name: number of replicons
Attribute.Description: Number of replicons in nuclear genome

Attribute.Name: number of residents
Attribute.Description: The number of individuals currently occupying in the sampling location

Attribute.Name: number of samples collected
Attribute.Description: The number of samples collected during the current sampling event

Attribute.Name: observed biotic relationship
Attribute.Description: Free-living or from host (define relationship)

Attribute.Name: observed coinfecting organisms in host of host
Attribute.Description: The taxonomic name of any coinfecting organism observed in a symbiotic relationship with the host of the sampled host organism, e.g. where a sample collected from a host trematode species (A) which was collected from a host_of_host fish (B) that was also infected with a nematode (C), the value here would be (C) the nematode {species name} or {common name}. Multiple co-infecting species may be added in a comma-separated list. For listing symbiotic organisms associated with the host (A) use the term Observed host symbiont

Attribute.Name: observed host symbionts
Attribute.Description: The taxonomic name of the organism(s) found living in mutualistic, commensalistic, or parasitic symbiosis with the specific host

Attribute.Name: occupancy at sampling
Attribute.Description: number of occupants present at time of sample within the given space

Attribute.Name: occupancy documentation
Attribute.Description: The type of documentation of occupancy, e.g., automated count, estimate, manual count, videos

Attribute.Name: occupant density at sampling
Attribute.Description: average number of occupants at time of sampling per square footage

Attribute.Name: occupation
Attribute.Description: most frequent job performed by subject

Attribute.Name: oil water contact depth
Attribute.Description: Depth of the original oil water contact (OWC) zone (average) (m TVDSS)

Attribute.Name: organic carbon
Attribute.Description: concentration of organic carbon

Attribute.Name: organic matter
Attribute.Description: concentration of organic matter

Attribute.Name: organic nitrogen
Attribute.Description: concentration of organic nitrogen

Attribute.Name: organic particles
Attribute.Description: concentration of particles such as faeces, hairs, food, vomit, paper fibers, plant material, humus, etc.

Attribute.Name: organism count
Attribute.Description: total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample,should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts

Attribute.Name: organism count qPCR information
Attribute.Description: If qpcr was used for the cell count, the target gene name, the primer sequence and the cycling conditions should also be provided, e.g., 16S rrna; FWD:ACGTAGCTATGACGT REV:GTGCTAGTCGAGTAC; initial denaturation:90C_5min; denaturation:90C_2min; annealing:52C_30 sec; elongation:72C_30 sec; 90 C for 1 min; final elongation:72C_5min; 30 cycles

Attribute.Name: orientations of exterior wall
Attribute.Description: The orientation of the exterior wall, e.g., north, south, east, west, northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest

Attribute.Name: orientations of exterior window
Attribute.Description: The compass direction the exterior window of the room is facing, e.g., north, south, east, west, northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest

Attribute.Name: original subject id
Attribute.Description: dbgap_public dictionary

Attribute.Name: outbreak
Attribute.Description: Submitter designated name for an occurrence of more cases of disease than expected in a given area or among a specific group of people over a particular period of time.

Attribute.Name: outside relative humidity
Attribute.Description: The recorded outside relative humidity value at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: oxygen
Attribute.Description: oxygen (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: oxygenation status of sample
Attribute.Description: oxygenation status of sample

Attribute.Name: pH
Attribute.Description: pH measurement

Attribute.Name: pH method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining pH

Attribute.Name: pH regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving exposure of plants to varying levels of pH of the growth media; can include multiple regimen

Attribute.Name: part of plant or animal
Attribute.Description: The anatomical part of the organism being involved in food production or consumption; e.g., a carrot is the root of the plant (root vegetable). This field accepts terms listed under part of plant or animal (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03420116)

Attribute.Name: particle classification
Attribute.Description: particles are classified, based on their size, into six general categories:clay, silt, sand, gravel, cobbles, and boulders; should include amount of particle preceded by the name of the particle type; can include multiple values

Attribute.Name: particulate organic carbon
Attribute.Description: concentration of particulate organic carbon

Attribute.Name: particulate organic nitrogen
Attribute.Description: concentration of particulate organic nitrogen

Attribute.Name: passage history
Attribute.Description: Number of passages and passage method

Attribute.Name: passage method
Attribute.Description: Description of how the organism was passaged. Provide a short description, e.g., AVL buffer+30%EtOH lysate received from Respiratory Lab. P3 passage in Vero-1 via bioreactor large-scale batch passage. P3 batch derived from the SP-2/reference lab strain. If not passaged, put ""not applicable"".

Attribute.Name: passage number
Attribute.Description: The number of known passages, e.g., 3. If not passaged, put ""not applicable"".

Attribute.Name: pathogenicity
Attribute.Description: To what is the entity pathogenic

Attribute.Name: pathotype
Attribute.Description: Some bacterial specific pathotypes (example Eschericia coli - STEC, UPEC)

Attribute.Name: pathovar
Attribute.Description: Taxonomy below subspecies; a variety (in bacteria, fungi or virus) usually based on its pathogenic properties. Sometimes used as equivalent to subspecies.

Attribute.Name: permeability
Attribute.Description: Measure of the ability of a hydrocarbon resource to allow fluids to pass through it. Additional information: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Permeability_(earth_sciences)

Attribute.Name: perturbation
Attribute.Description: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

Attribute.Name: pesticide regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving use of insecticides; should include the name of pesticide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple pesticide regimens

Attribute.Name: petroleum hydrocarbon
Attribute.Description: concentration of petroleum hydrocarbon

Attribute.Name: phaeopigments
Attribute.Description: concentration of phaeopigments; can include multiple phaeopigments

Attribute.Name: phenotype
Attribute.Description: Phenotype of sampled organism. For Phenotypic quality Ontology (PATO) (v1.269) terms, please see http://bioportal.bioontology.org/visualize/44601

Attribute.Name: phosphate
Attribute.Description: concentration of phosphate

Attribute.Name: phospholipid fatty acid
Attribute.Description: concentration of phospholipid fatty acids; can include multiple values

Attribute.Name: photon flux
Attribute.Description: measurement of photon flux

Attribute.Name: photosynthetic activity
Attribute.Description: Measurement of photosythetic activity (i.e. leaf gas exchange / chlorophyll fluorescence emissions / reflectance / transpiration) Please also include the term method term detailing the method of activity measurement

Attribute.Name: photosynthetic activity method
Attribute.Description: Reference or method used in measurement of photosythetic activity

Attribute.Name: plant body site
Attribute.Description: name of body site that the sample was obtained from. For Plant Ontology (PO) (v 20) terms, see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PO

Attribute.Name: plant growth medium
Attribute.Description: Type of the media used for growing sampled plants, e.g., soil [ENVO:00001998]

Attribute.Name: plant product
Attribute.Description: substance produced by the plant, where the sample was obtained from

Attribute.Name: plant reproductive part
Attribute.Description: Plant reproductive part used in the field during planting to start the crop, e.g., plant cutting, pregerminated seed, ratoon, seed, seedling, whole mature plant

Attribute.Name: plant sex
Attribute.Description: Sex of the reproductive parts on the whole plant, e.g., androdioecious, androecious, androgynous, androgynomonoecious, andromonoecious, bisexual, dichogamous, diclinous, dioecious, gynodioecious, gynoecious, gynomonoecious, hermaphroditic, imperfect, monoclinous, monoecious, perfect, polygamodioecious, polygamomonoecious, polygamous, protandrous, protogynous, subandroecious, subdioecious, subgynoecious, synoecious, trimonoecious, trioecious, unisexual

Attribute.Name: plant structure
Attribute.Description: Name of plant structure the sample was obtained from; for Plant Ontology (PO) (v releases/2017-12-14) terms, see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PO, e.g., petiole epidermis (PO_0000051). If an individual flower is sampled, the sex of it can be recorded here

Attribute.Name: plant water delivery method
Attribute.Description: Description of the equipment or method used to distribute water to crops. This field encourages terms listed under irrigation process (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/AGRO_00000006). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes, e.g., drip irrigation process [AGRO:00000056]

Attribute.Name: ploidy
Attribute.Description: Ploidy level of genome (eg., haploid, diploid)

Attribute.Name: pollutants
Attribute.Description: pollutant types and, amount or concentrations measured at the time of sampling; can report multiple pollutants by entering numeric values preceded by name of pollutant

Attribute.Name: pooling of DNA extracts
Attribute.Description: were multiple DNA extractions mixed? how many?

Attribute.Name: population
Attribute.Description: for human: ; for plants: filial generation, number of progeny, genetic structure

Attribute.Name: porosity
Attribute.Description: porosity of deposited sediment is volume of voids divided by the total volume of sample

Attribute.Name: positive control type
Attribute.Description: The substance, mixture, product, or apparatus used to verify that a process which is part of an investigation delivers a true positive

Attribute.Name: potassium
Attribute.Description: concentration of potassium

Attribute.Name: pour point
Attribute.Description: Temperature at which a liquid becomes semi solid and loses its flow characteristics. In crude oil a high pour point is generally associated with a high paraffin content, typically found in crude deriving from a larger proportion of plant material (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/pour_point)

Attribute.Name: pregnancy
Attribute.Description: date due of pregnancy

Attribute.Name: presence of pets or farm animals
Attribute.Description: specification of presence of pets or farm animals in the environment of subject, if yes the animals should be specified; can include multiple animals present

Attribute.Name: presence of pets, animals, or insects
Attribute.Description: The type and number of animals or insects present in the sampling space, e.g., cat 10, dog 2, rodent 100, snake 1

Attribute.Name: preservative added to sample
Attribute.Description: Preservative added to the sample, e.g. Rnalater, alcohol, formaldehyde. Where appropriate include volume added, e.g. Rnalater; 2 ml

Attribute.Name: pressure
Attribute.Description: pressure to which the sample is subject, in atmospheres

Attribute.Name: pretreatment
Attribute.Description: the process of pre-treatment removes materials that can be easily collected from the raw wastewater

Attribute.Name: previous land use
Attribute.Description: previous land use and dates

Attribute.Name: previous land use method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining previous land use and dates

Attribute.Name: primary production
Attribute.Description: measurement of primary production

Attribute.Name: primary treatment
Attribute.Description: the process to produce both a generally homogeneous liquid capable of being treated biologically and a sludge that can be separately treated or processed

Attribute.Name: prior SARS-CoV-2 antiviral treatment
Attribute.Description: Has the host received SARS-CoV-2 antiviral treatment?

Attribute.Name: prior SARS-CoV-2 infection
Attribute.Description: Did the host have a prior SARS-CoV-2 infection?

Attribute.Name: prior SARS-CoV-2 vaccination
Attribute.Description: Has the host received a SARS-CoV-2 vaccination?

Attribute.Name: production labeling claims
Attribute.Description: Labeling claims containing descriptors such as wild caught, free-range, organic, free-range, industrial, hormone-free, antibiotic free, cage free

Attribute.Name: production rate
Attribute.Description: Oil and/or gas production rates per well, e.g., 524 m3/day

Attribute.Name: production start date
Attribute.Description: Date of field's first production

Attribute.Name: profile position
Attribute.Description: cross-sectional position in the hillslope where sample was collected.sample area position in relation to surrounding areas

Attribute.Name: project name
Attribute.Description: A concise name that describes the overall project, for example "Analysis of sequences collected from Antarctic soil"

Attribute.Name: propagation
Attribute.Description: phage: lytic/lysogenic/temperate/obligately lytic; plasmid: incompatibility group; eukaryote: asexual/sexual

Attribute.Name: pulmonary disorder
Attribute.Description: history of pulmonary disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: pulse
Attribute.Description: resting pulse, measured as beats per minute

Attribute.Name: purchase date
Attribute.Description: The date a food product was purchased by consumer

Attribute.Name: purpose of sampling
Attribute.Description: the reason that the sample was collected, e.g., active surveillance in response to an outbreak, active surveillance not initiated by an outbreak, clinical trial, cluster investigation, environmental assessment, farm sample, field trial, for cause, industry internal investigation, market sample, passive surveillance, population based studies, research, research and development

Attribute.Name: purpose of sequencing
Attribute.Description: The reason the sample was sequenced, e.g., baseline surveillance (random sampling)

Attribute.Name: purpose of wastewater sampling
Attribute.Description: The reason the sample was collected
Attribute.Format: ['', 'public health surveillance community-level', 'public health surveillance institution-level', 'public health surveillance building-level', 'research', 'other', 'missing', 'not applicable', 'not collected', 'not provided', 'restricted access']

Attribute.Name: purpose of wastewater sequencing
Attribute.Description: The reason the sample was sequenced, e.g., identification of mutations within a specific region, presence of clinically known mutations, or diversity of mutations across entire genome

Attribute.Name: quadrant position
Attribute.Description: The quadrant position of the sampling room within the building, e.g., north side, west side, south side, east side

Attribute.Name: quantity purchased
Attribute.Description: The quantity of food purchased by consumer

Attribute.Name: radiation regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving exposure of plant or a plant part to a particular radiation regimen; should include the radiation type, amount or intensity administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple radiation regimens

Attribute.Name: rainfall regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving an exposure to a given amount of rainfall; can include multiple regimens

Attribute.Name: reactor type
Attribute.Description: anaerobic digesters can be designed and engineered to operate using a number of different process configurations, as batch or continuous, mesophilic, high solid or low solid, and single stage or multistage

Attribute.Name: redox potential
Attribute.Description: redox potential, measured relative to a hydrogen cell, indicating oxidation or reduction potential

Attribute.Name: reference for biomaterial
Attribute.Description: Primary publication or genome report

Attribute.Name: reference material
Attribute.Description: Indicates that a standards body or external group asserts this sample is reference material, eg, 'NIST reference material for genome sequencing validation'.

Attribute.Name: relationship to oxygen
Attribute.Description: Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments, eg, aerobe, anaerobe, facultative, microaerophilic, microanaerobe, obligate aerobe, obligate anaerobe, missing, not applicable, not collected, not provided, restricted access
Attribute.Format: ['', 'aerobe', 'anaerobe', 'facultative', 'microaerophilic', 'microanaerobe', 'obligate aerobe', 'obligate anaerobe', 'missing', 'not applicable', 'not collected', 'not provided', 'restricted access']

Attribute.Name: relative air humidity
Attribute.Description: partial vapor and air pressure, density of the vapor and air, or by the actual mass of the vapor and air

Attribute.Name: relative location of sample
Attribute.Description: Location of sample to other parts of the farm, e.g. under crop plant, near irrigation ditch, from the dirt road, from air above crops, nearby river, e.g., furrow

Attribute.Name: relative sampling location
Attribute.Description: The sampling location within the train car, e.g., edge of car, center of car, under a seat

Attribute.Name: repository
Attribute.Description: the name of the institution where the sample or DNA extract is held or "sample not available" if the sample was used in its entirety for analysis or otherwise not retained

Attribute.Name: reservoir name
Attribute.Description: Name of the reservoir, e.g., Carapebus

Attribute.Name: resins wt%
Attribute.Description: Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene (SARA) is an analysis method that divides crude oil components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene)

Attribute.Name: room air exchange rate
Attribute.Description: The rate at which outside air replaces indoor air in a given space

Attribute.Name: room architectural elements
Attribute.Description: The unique details and component parts that, together, form the architecture of a distinguisahable space within a built structure

Attribute.Name: room condition
Attribute.Description: The condition of the room at the time of sampling, e.g., new, visible wear, needs repair, damaged, rupture, visible signs of mold/mildew

Attribute.Name: room count
Attribute.Description: The total count of rooms in the built structure including all room types

Attribute.Name: room dimensions
Attribute.Description: The length, width and height of sampling room

Attribute.Name: room door distance
Attribute.Description: Distance between doors (meters) in the hallway between the sampling room and adjacent rooms

Attribute.Name: room location in building
Attribute.Description: The position of the room within the building, e.g., corner room, interior room, exterior wall

Attribute.Name: room moisture damage or mold history
Attribute.Description: The history of moisture damage or mold in the past 12 months. Number of events of moisture damage or mold observed

Attribute.Name: room net area
Attribute.Description: The net floor area of sampling room. Net area excludes wall thicknesses

Attribute.Name: room occupancy
Attribute.Description: Count of room occupancy at time of sampling

Attribute.Name: room sampling position
Attribute.Description: The horizontal sampling position in the room relative to architectural elements, e.g., north corner, south corner, west corner, east corner, northeast corner, northwest corner, southeast corner, southwest corner, center

Attribute.Name: room type
Attribute.Description: The main purpose or activity of the sampling room. A room is any distinguishable space within a structure, e.g., attic, bathroom, closet, conference room, elevator, examining room, hallway, kitchen, mail room, private office, open office, stairwell,restroom, lobby, vestibule, mechanical or electrical room, data center, laboratory_wet, laboratory_dry, gymnasium, natatorium, auditorium, lockers, cafe, warehouse

Attribute.Name: room volume
Attribute.Description: Volume of sampling room

Attribute.Name: room window count
Attribute.Description: Number of windows in the room

Attribute.Name: rooms connected by a doorway
Attribute.Description: List of rooms connected to the sampling room by a doorway, e.g., attic, bathroom, closet, conference room, elevator, examining room, hallway, kitchen, mail room, office, stairwell

Attribute.Name: rooms that are on the same hallway
Attribute.Description: List of room(s) (room number, room name) located in the same hallway as sampling room

Attribute.Name: rooms that share a door with sampling room
Attribute.Description: List of room(s) (room number, room name) sharing a door with the sampling room

Attribute.Name: rooms that share a wall with sampling room
Attribute.Description: List of room(s) (room number, room name) sharing a wall with the sampling room

Attribute.Name: rooting conditions
Attribute.Description: Relevant rooting conditions such as field plot size, sowing density, container dimensions, number of plants per container

Attribute.Name: rooting medium carbon
Attribute.Description: Source of organic carbon in the culture rooting medium, e.g., sucrose

Attribute.Name: rooting medium macronutrients
Attribute.Description: Measurement of the culture rooting medium macronutrients (N,P, K, Ca, Mg, S), e.g., KH2PO4 (170mg/L)

Attribute.Name: rooting medium micronutrients
Attribute.Description: Measurement of the culture rooting medium micronutrients (Fe, Mn, Zn, B, Cu, Mo), e.g., H3BO3 (6.2mg/L)

Attribute.Name: rooting medium organic supplements
Attribute.Description: Organic supplements of the culture rooting medium, such as vitamins, amino acids, organic acids, antibiotics activated charcoal, e.g., nicotinic acid (0.5 mg/L)

Attribute.Name: rooting medium pH
Attribute.Description: pH measurement of the culture rooting medium, e.g., 5.5

Attribute.Name: rooting medium regulators
Attribute.Description: Growth regulators in the culture rooting medium such as cytokinins, auxins, gybberellins, abscisic acid, e.g., 0.5 mg/L NAA

Attribute.Name: rooting medium solidifier
Attribute.Description: Specification of the solidifying agent in the culture rooting medium, e.g., agar

Attribute.Name: route of transmission
Attribute.Description: Description of path taken by the symbiotic host organism being sampled in order to establish a symbiotic relationship with the host (with which it was observed at the time of sampling) via a mode of transmission (specified in mode_transmission), e.g., environmental:faecal-oral, transplacental, vector-borne:vector penetration

Attribute.Name: salinity
Attribute.Description: salinity measurement

Attribute.Name: salinity method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining salinity

Attribute.Name: salt regimen
Attribute.Description: information about treatment involving use of salts as supplement to liquid and soil growth media; should include the name of salt, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple salt regimens

Attribute.Name: same as
Attribute.Description: indicates that the same physical sample has multiple BioSample records

Attribute.Name: sample capture status
Attribute.Description: Reason for the sample, e.g., active surveillance in response to an outbreak, active surveillance not initiated by an outbreak, farm sample, market sample

Attribute.Name: sample collection device or method
Attribute.Description: Method or device employed for collecting sample

Attribute.Name: sample collection method
Attribute.Description: The method employed for collecting the sample

Attribute.Name: sample collection point
Attribute.Description: Sampling point on the asset where sample was collected, e.g., well, test well, drilling rig, wellhead, separator, storage tank

Attribute.Name: sample disease stage
Attribute.Description: Stage of the disease at the time of sample collection, e.g., dissemination, growth and reproduction, infection, inoculation, penetration

Attribute.Name: sample location condition
Attribute.Description: The condition of the sample location at the time of sampling, e.g., damaged, new, rupture, visible signs of mold-mildew, visible weariness repair

Attribute.Name: sample material processing
Attribute.Description: Processing applied to the sample during or after isolation

Attribute.Name: sample material type (host or environmental context)
Attribute.Description: The type of material from which the sample was obtained. For the Hydrocarbon package, samples include types like core, rock trimmings, drill cuttings, piping section, coupon, pigging debris, solid deposit, produced fluid, produced water, injected water, swabs, etc. For the Food Package, samples are usually categorized as food, body products or tissues, or environmental material. This field accepts terms listed under environmental specimen (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0001246)

Attribute.Name: sample measured depth
Attribute.Description: In non deviated well, measured depth is equal to the true vertical depth, TVD (TVD=TVDSS plus the reference or datum it refers to). In deviated wells, the MD is the length of trajectory of the borehole measured from the same reference or datum. Common datums used are ground level (GL), drilling rig floor (DF), rotary table (RT), kelly bushing (KB) and mean sea level (MSL). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field

Attribute.Name: sample name
Attribute.Description: sample name in source database

Attribute.Name: sample pooling
Attribute.Description: Physical combination of several instances of like material, e.g., RNA extracted from samples or dishes of cell cultures into one big aliquot of cells. Please provide a short description of the samples that were pooled

Attribute.Name: sample size
Attribute.Description: Amount or size of sample (volume, mass or area) that was collected

Attribute.Name: sample size sorting method
Attribute.Description: method by which samples are sorted

Attribute.Name: sample source material category
Attribute.Description: This is the scientific role or category that the subject organism or material has with respect to an investigation. This field accepts terms listed under specimen source material category (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0001237 or http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0100051)

Attribute.Name: sample storage device
Attribute.Description: The container used to store the sample. This field accepts terms listed under container (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C43186). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the storage device

Attribute.Name: sample storage media
Attribute.Description: The liquid that is added to the sample collection device prior to sampling. If the sample is pre-hydrated, indicate the liquid media the sample is pre-hydrated with for storage purposes. This field accepts terms listed under microbiological culture medium (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/MICRO_0000067). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the sample storage media

Attribute.Name: sample storage solution
Attribute.Description: Solution within which sample was stored, if any

Attribute.Name: sample subtype
Attribute.Description: Name of sample sub-type, e.g., oil phase, water phase, biofilm, not applicable

Attribute.Name: sample surface moisture
Attribute.Description: Degree of water held on a sampled surface, e.g., intermittent moisture, not present, submerged

Attribute.Name: sample transport conditions
Attribute.Description: Sample transport duration (in days or hrs) and temperature the sample was exposed to (e.g., 5.5 days; 20C)

Attribute.Name: sample transport container
Attribute.Description: Container in which the sample was stored during transport. Indicate the location name, e.g., bottle, cooler, glass vial, plastic vial, vendor supplied container

Attribute.Name: sample transport duration
Attribute.Description: The duration of time from when the sample was collected until processed. Indicate the duration for which the sample was stored written in ISO 8601 format

Attribute.Name: sample transport temperature
Attribute.Description: Temperature at which sample was transported, e.g., -20 or 4 degree Celsius

Attribute.Name: sample true vertical depth subsea
Attribute.Description: Depth of the sample i.e. The vertical distance between the sea level and the sampled position in the subsurface. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples e.g., 1325.75-1362.25 m

Attribute.Name: sample type
Attribute.Description: Sample type, such as cell culture, mixed culture, tissue sample, whole organism, single cell, metagenomic assembly

Attribute.Name: sample use
Attribute.Description: dbgap_public dictionary

Attribute.Name: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
Attribute.Description: volume (mL) or weight (g) of sample processed for DNA extraction
Attribute.Synonym: sample volume or weight for dna extraction

Attribute.Name: sample well name
Attribute.Description: Name of the well where sample was taken, e.g., BXA1123

Attribute.Name: sampling day weather
Attribute.Description: The weather on the sampling day, e.g., clear sky, cloudy, foggy, hail, rain, snow, sleet, sunny, windy

Attribute.Name: sampling floor
Attribute.Description: The floor of the building, where the sampling room is located, e.g., 1st floor, 2nd floor, basement, lobby

Attribute.Name: sampling room ID or name
Attribute.Description: Sampling room number. This ID should be consistent with the designations on the building floor plans

Attribute.Name: sampling room sterilization method
Attribute.Description: The method used to sterilize the sampling room. This field accepts terms listed under electromagnetic radiation (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_01001026). If the proper descriptor is not listed, please use text to describe the sampling room sterilization method. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes

Attribute.Name: sampling time outside
Attribute.Description: The recent and long term history of outside sampling

Attribute.Name: sanitizer used during postharvest cleaning
Attribute.Description: Substance intended for preventing, neutralizing, destroying, repelling, or mitigating the effects of any pest or microorganism; indicate the sanitizer used during the postharvest cleaning process. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes, e.g., chlorine bleach

Attribute.Name: saturates wt%
Attribute.Description: Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene (SARA) is an analysis method that divides crude oil components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene)

Attribute.Name: season
Attribute.Description: The season when sampling occurred. Any of the four periods into which the year is divided by the equinoxes and solstices. This field accepts terms listed under season (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C94729)

Attribute.Name: seasonal environment
Attribute.Description: treatment involving an exposure to a particular season (e.g. winter, summer, rabi, rainy etc.)

Attribute.Name: seasonal use
Attribute.Description: The seasons the space is occupied, e.g., spring, summer, fall, winter

Attribute.Name: secondary and tertiary recovery methods and start date
Attribute.Description: Additional (i.e. secondary, tertiary, etc.) recovery methods deployed for increase of hydrocarbon recovery from resource and start date for each one of them, e.g., water injection {timestamp}, dump flood {timestamp}, gas injection {timestamp}, wag immiscible injection {timestamp}, polymer addition {timestamp}, surfactant addition {timestamp}

Attribute.Name: secondary treatment
Attribute.Description: the process for substantially degrading the biological content of the sewage

Attribute.Name: sediment type
Attribute.Description: information about the sediment type based on major constituents

Attribute.Name: sequenced by
Attribute.Description: The name of the agency that generated the sequence, e.g., Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

Attribute.Name: serotype
Attribute.Description: Taxonomy below subspecies; a variety (in bacteria, fungi or virus) usually based on its antigenic properties. Same as serovar and serogroup. e.g. serotype="H1N1" in Influenza A virus CY098518.

Attribute.Name: serovar
Attribute.Description: Taxonomy below subspecies; a variety (in bacteria, fungi or virus) usually based on its antigenic properties. Same as serovar and serotype. Sometimes used as species identifier in bacteria with shaky taxonomy, e.g. Leptospira, serovar saopaolo S76607 (65357 in Entrez).

Attribute.Name: serovar or serotype
Attribute.Description: A characterization of a cell or microorganism based on the antigenic properties of the molecules on its surface. Indicate the name of a serovar or serotype of interest. This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy

Attribute.Name: sewage type
Attribute.Description: type of wastewater treatment plant as municipial or industrial

Attribute.Name: sex
Attribute.Description: physical sex of sampled organism
Attribute.Format: ['', 'male', 'female', 'pooled male and female', 'neuter', 'hermaphrodite', 'intersex', 'not determined', 'missing', 'not applicable', 'not collected', 'not provided', 'restricted access']

Attribute.Name: sexual activity
Attribute.Description: current sexual partner and frequency of sex

Attribute.Name: shading device condition
Attribute.Description: The physical condition of the shading device at the time of sampling, e.g., damaged, needs repair, new, rupture, visible wear

Attribute.Name: shading device location
Attribute.Description: The location of the shading device in relation to the built structure, e.g., exterior, interior

Attribute.Name: shading device material
Attribute.Description: The material the shading device is composed of

Attribute.Name: shading device signs of water/mold
Attribute.Description: Signs of the presence of mold or mildew on the shading device, e.g., presence of mold visible, no presence of mold visible

Attribute.Name: shading device type
Attribute.Description: The type of shading device, e.g., bahama shutters, exterior roll blind, gambrel awning, hood awning, porchroller awning, sarasota shutters, slatted aluminum, solid aluminum awning, sun screen, tree, trellis, venetian awning

Attribute.Name: sieving
Attribute.Description: collection design of pooled samples and/or sieve size and amount of sample sieved

Attribute.Name: silicate
Attribute.Description: concentration of silicate

Attribute.Name: size fraction selected
Attribute.Description: Filtering pore size used in sample preparation, e.g., 0-0.22 micrometer

Attribute.Name: size-fraction lower threshold
Attribute.Description: Refers to the mesh/pore size used to pre-filter/pre-sort the sample. Materials larger than the size threshold are excluded from the sample

Attribute.Name: size-fraction upper threshold
Attribute.Description: Refers to the mesh/pore size used to retain the sample. Materials smaller than the size threshold are excluded from the sample

Attribute.Name: slope aspect
Attribute.Description: the direction a slope faces. While looking down a slope use a compass to record the direction you are facing (direction or degrees); e.g., NW or 315°. This measure provides an indication of sun and wind exposure that will influence soil temperature and evapotranspiration.

Attribute.Name: slope gradient
Attribute.Description: commonly called “slope.” The angle between ground surface and a horizontal line (in percent). This is the direction that overland water would flow. This measure is usually taken with a hand level meter or clinometer.

Attribute.Name: sludge retention time
Attribute.Description: the time activated sludge remains in reactor

Attribute.Name: smoker
Attribute.Description: specification of smoking status

Attribute.Name: sodium
Attribute.Description: sodium concentration

Attribute.Name: soil conductivity
Attribute.Description: Conductivity of soil at time of sampling

Attribute.Name: soil cover
Attribute.Description: Description of the material covering the sampled soil. This field accepts terms under ENVO:00010483, environmental material

Attribute.Name: soil depth
Attribute.Description: The vertical distance below local surface, e.g., for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples

Attribute.Name: soil horizon
Attribute.Description: specific layer in the land area which measures parallel to the soil surface and possesses physical characteristics which differ from the layers above and beneath
Attribute.Format: ['', 'O horizon', 'A horizon', 'E horizon', 'B horizon', 'C horizon', 'R layer', 'Permafrost']

Attribute.Name: soil pH
Attribute.Description: The pH of soil at time of sampling

Attribute.Name: soil sediment porosity
Attribute.Description: Porosity of soil or deposited sediment is volume of voids divided by the total volume of sample

Attribute.Name: soil temperature
Attribute.Description: Temperature of soil at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: soil texture classification
Attribute.Description: One of the 12 soil texture classes use to describe soil texture based on the relative proportion of different grain sizes of mineral particles [sand (50 um to 2 mm), silt (2 um to 50 um), and clay (<2 um)] in a soil, e.g., clay, clay loam, loam, loamy sand, sand, sandy clay, sandy clay loam, sandy loam, silt, silty clay, silty clay loam, silt loam

Attribute.Name: soil texture measurement
Attribute.Description: the relative proportion of different grain sizes of mineral particles in a soil, as described using a standard system; express as % sand (50 um to 2 mm), silt (2 um to 50 um), and clay (<2 um) with textural name (e.g., silty clay loam) optional.

Attribute.Name: soil texture method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining soil texture

Attribute.Name: soil type
Attribute.Description: soil series name or other lower-level classification

Attribute.Name: soil type method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining soil series name or other lower-level classification

Attribute.Name: solar irradiance
Attribute.Description: the amount of solar energy that arrives at a specific area of a surface during a specific time interval

Attribute.Name: soluble inorganic material
Attribute.Description: concentration of substances such as ammonia, road-salt, sea-salt, cyanide, hydrogen sulfide, thiocyanates, thiosulfates, etc.

Attribute.Name: soluble organic material
Attribute.Description: concentration of substances such as urea, fruit sugars, soluble proteins, drugs, pharmaceuticals, etc.

Attribute.Name: soluble reactive phosphorus
Attribute.Description: concentration of soluble reactive phosphorus

Attribute.Name: source material identifiers
Attribute.Description: unique identifier assigned to a material sample used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples.

Attribute.Name: source name
Attribute.Description: Sample source name or description

Attribute.Name: source of UViGs
Attribute.Description: Type of dataset from which the UViG was obtained
Attribute.Format: ['', 'metagenome (not viral targeted)', 'viral fraction metagenome (virome)', 'sequence-targeted metagenome', 'metatranscriptome (not viral targeted)', 'viral fraction RNA metagenome (RNA virome)', 'sequence-targeted RNA metagenome', 'microbial single amplified genome (SAG)', 'viral single amplified genome (vSAG)', 'isolate microbial genome', 'missing', 'not applicable', 'not collected', 'not provided', 'restricted access']

Attribute.Name: source rock depositional environment
Attribute.Description: Source rock depositional environment (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Source_rock), e.g., lacustine, fluvioldeltaic, fluviomarine, marine

Attribute.Name: source rock geological age
Attribute.Description: Geological age of source rock (Additional info: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Period_(geology)), e.g., archean, cambrian, carboniferous, cenozoic, cretaceous, devonian, jurassic, mesozoic, neogene, ordovician, paleogene, paleozoic, permian, precambrian, proterozoic, silurian, triassic

Attribute.Name: source rock kerogen type
Attribute.Description: Origin of kerogen. Type I: Algal (aquatic), Type II: planktonic and soft plant material (aquatic or terrestrial), Type III: terrestrial woody/ fibrous plant material (terrestrial), Type IV: oxidized recycled woody debris (terrestrial) (additional information: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kerogen), e.g., type I, type II, type III, type IV

Attribute.Name: source rock lithology
Attribute.Description: Lithology of source rock (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Source_rock), e.g., clastic, carbonate, coal, biosilicieous

Attribute.Name: source type
Attribute.Description: Controlled vocabulary describing the isolation_source. Choose the best fit term: Human, Animal, Food, Environmental, Other, e.g., Food

Attribute.Name: space typical state
Attribute.Description: customary or normal state of the space
Attribute.Format: ['', 'typical occupied', 'typically unoccupied', 'missing', 'not applicable', 'not collected', 'not provided', 'restricted access']

Attribute.Name: special diet
Attribute.Description: specification of special diet; can include multiple special diets

Attribute.Name: specific humidity
Attribute.Description: The mass of water vapour in a unit mass of moist air, usually expressed as grams of vapour per kilogram of air, or, in air conditioning, as grains per pound

Attribute.Name: specific intended consumer
Attribute.Description: Food consumer type, human or animal, for which the food product is produced and marketed. This field encourages terms listed under food consumer group (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03510136), e.g., infant or toddler as food consumer [FOODON:03510020]
Attribute.Format: ['', 'animal as food consumer', 'laboratory animal as food consumer', 'non-food animal as food consumer', 'pet animal as consumer', 'pet fish as consumer', 'pet cat as consumer', 'pet bird as consumer', 'pet dog as consumer', 'sheep or goat as consumer', 'food animal as consumer', 'food fish as consumer', 'poultry as consumer', 'pig as consumer', 'game as consumer', 'rabbit as consumer', 'cattle as consumer', 'horse as consumer', 'human as food consumer', 'adult human as food consumer', 'man as food consumer', 'woman as food consumer', 'senior as food consumer', 'athlete as food consumer', 'bodybuilder as food consumer', 'weight-reducer as food consumer', 'human as food consumer, four years and above', 'teenager as food consumer', 'child as food consumer, less than four years', 'infant or toddler as food consumer', 'toddler as food consumer, 12 months and onwards', 'infant as food consumer', 'missing', 'not applicable', 'not collected', 'not provided', 'restricted access']

Attribute.Name: specifications
Attribute.Description: The building specifications, e.g., operation, as built, construction, bid, design, photos

Attribute.Name: specimen voucher
Attribute.Description: Identifier for the physical specimen. Use format: "[<institution-code>:[<collection-code>:]]<specimen_id>", eg, "UAM:Mamm:52179". Intended as a reference to the physical specimen that remains after it was analyzed. If the specimen was destroyed in the process of analysis, electronic images (e-vouchers) are an adequate substitute for a physical voucher specimen. Ideally the specimens will be deposited in a curated museum, herbarium, or frozen tissue collection, but often they will remain in a personal or laboratory collection for some time before they are deposited in a curated collection. There are three forms of specimen_voucher qualifiers. If the text of the qualifier includes one or more colons it is a 'structured voucher'. Structured vouchers include institution-codes (and optional collection-codes) taken from a controlled vocabulary maintained by the INSDC that denotes the museum or herbarium collection where the specimen resides, please visit: http://www.insdc.org/controlled-vocabulary-specimenvoucher-qualifier.

Attribute.Name: spike in organism
Attribute.Description: Taxonomic information about the spike-in organism(s). This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes

Attribute.Name: spike-in bacterial serovar or serotype
Attribute.Description: Taxonomic information about the spike-in organism(s) at the serovar or serotype level. This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes
Attribute.Synonym: spike in bacterial serovar or serotype

Attribute.Name: spike-in growth medium
Attribute.Description: A liquid or gel containing nutrients, salts, and other factors formulated to support the growth of microorganisms, cells, or plants (National Cancer Institute Thesaurus). A growth medium is a culture medium which has the disposition to encourage growth of particular bacteria to the exclusion of others in the same growth environment. In this case, list the culture medium used to propagate the spike-in bacteria during preparation of spike-in inoculum. This field accepts terms listed under microbiological culture medium (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/MICRO_0000067). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the spike in growth media

Attribute.Name: spike-in microbial strain
Attribute.Description: Taxonomic information about the spike-in organism(s) at the strain level. This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes

Attribute.Name: spike-in organism count
Attribute.Description: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g., qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) should also be provided, e.g., total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qPCR

Attribute.Name: spike-in with antibiotics
Attribute.Description: Antimicrobials used in research study to assess effects of exposure on microbiome of a specific site. Please list antimicrobial, common name and/or class and concentration used for spike-in

Attribute.Name: spike-in with heavy metals
Attribute.Description: Heavy metals used in research study to assess effects of exposure on microbiome of a specific site. Please list heavy metals and concentration used for spike-in

Attribute.Name: standing water regimen
Attribute.Description: treatment involving an exposure to standing water during a plant's life span, types can be flood water or standing water; can include multiple regimens

Attribute.Name: storage conditions
Attribute.Description: explain how and for how long the soil sample was stored before DNA extraction.

Attribute.Name: strain
Attribute.Description: microbial or eukaryotic strain name

Attribute.Name: study completion status
Attribute.Description: specification of study completion status, if no the reason should be specified

Attribute.Name: study design
Attribute.Description: Epidemiological or omics reseach design context that this biosample was used in.

Attribute.Name: study disease
Attribute.Description: dbgap_public dictionary

Attribute.Name: study incubation duration
Attribute.Description: Sample incubation duration if unpublished or unvalidated method is used. Indicate the timepoint written in ISO 8601 format

Attribute.Name: study incubation temperature
Attribute.Description: Sample incubation temperature if unpublished or unvalidated method is used

Attribute.Name: study name
Attribute.Description: dbgap_public dictionary

Attribute.Name: study treatment
Attribute.Description: A process in which the act is intended to modify or alter some other material entity. From the study design, each treatment is comprised of one level of one or multiple factors. This field accepts terms listed under treatment (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/MCO_0000866). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the study treatment. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes

Attribute.Name: subclone
Attribute.Description: Name for the derived clone or subculture from which the sample was taken.

Attribute.Name: subgroup
Attribute.Description: Taxonomy below subspecies; sometimes used in viruses to denote subgroups taken from a single isolate.

Attribute.Name: subject is affected
Attribute.Description: Case vs control status for the subject of this sample, for case-control studies

Attribute.Name: submitted sample id
Attribute.Description: dbgap_public dictionary

Attribute.Name: submitted subject id
Attribute.Description: dbgap_public dictionary

Attribute.Name: submitter handle
Attribute.Description: dbgap_public dictionary

Attribute.Name: subspecific genetic lineage
Attribute.Description: Information about the genetic distinctness of the lineage (eg., biovar, serovar)

Attribute.Name: substrain
Attribute.Description: One level below strain.

Attribute.Name: substructure type
Attribute.Description: substructure or under building is that largely hidden section of the building which is built off the foundations to the ground floor level

Attribute.Name: subtype
Attribute.Description: Used as classifier in viruses (e.g. HIV type 1, Group M, Subtype A).

Attribute.Name: sulfate
Attribute.Description: concentration of sulfate

Attribute.Name: sulfate in formation water
Attribute.Description: Original sulfate concentration in the hydrocarbon resource

Attribute.Name: sulfide
Attribute.Description: concentration of sulfide

Attribute.Name: surface humidity
Attribute.Description: surfaces: water activity as a function of air and material moisture

Attribute.Name: surface material
Attribute.Description: surface materials at the point of sampling
Attribute.Format: ['', 'concrete', 'wood', 'stone', 'tile', 'plastic', 'glass', 'vinyl', 'metal', 'carpet', 'stainless steel', 'paint', 'cinder blocks', 'hay bales', 'stucco', 'adobe', 'missing', 'not applicable', 'not collected', 'not provided', 'restricted access']

Attribute.Name: surface moisture
Attribute.Description: water held on a surface

Attribute.Name: surface moisture pH
Attribute.Description: pH measurement of surface

Attribute.Name: surface orientation
Attribute.Description: Describe which surface of the object is swabbed. (e.g underside, top, corner), e.g., underside

Attribute.Name: surface temperature
Attribute.Description: temperature of the surface at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: surface-air contaminant
Attribute.Description: contaminant identified on surface

Attribute.Name: suspended particulate matter
Attribute.Description: concentration of suspended particulate matter

Attribute.Name: suspended solids
Attribute.Description: concentration of substances including a wide variety of material, such as silt, decaying plant and animal matter, etc,; can include multiple substances

Attribute.Name: symbiotic host organism life cycle type
Attribute.Description: Type of life cycle of the symbiotic host species (the thing being sampled). Simple life cycles occur within a single host, complex ones within multiple different hosts over the course of their normal life cycle, e.g., complex life cycle, simple life cycle

Attribute.Name: technical sample replicate
Attribute.Description: Repeated measurements of the same sample that show independent measures of the noise associated with the equipment and the protocols

Attribute.Name: teleomorph
Attribute.Description: Genus and species of the sexual (fruiting) form of fungi - note that anamorph and teleomorph forms of the same taxon may have used taxonomic different names.

Attribute.Name: temperature
Attribute.Description: temperature of the sample at time of sampling

Attribute.Name: temperature outside house
Attribute.Description: The recorded temperature value at sampling time outside

Attribute.Name: tertiary treatment
Attribute.Description: the process providing a final treatment stage to raise the effluent quality before it is discharged to the receiving environment

Attribute.Name: tidal stage
Attribute.Description: stage of tide

Attribute.Name: tillage
Attribute.Description: note method(s) used for tilling

Attribute.Name: time since last toothbrushing
Attribute.Description: specification of the time since last toothbrushing

Attribute.Name: time since last wash
Attribute.Description: specification of the time since last wash

Attribute.Name: time-course duration
Attribute.Description: For time-course research studies involving samples of the food commodity, indicate the total duration of the time-course study

Attribute.Name: timepoint
Attribute.Description: Time point at which a sample or observation is made or taken from a biomaterial as measured from some reference point. Indicate the timepoint written in ISO 8601 format

Attribute.Name: tissue
Attribute.Description: Type of tissue the sample was taken from.

Attribute.Name: tissue culture growth media
Attribute.Description: description of plant tissue culture growth media used

Attribute.Name: tissue lib
Attribute.Description: Formal identifier that points to source institute and tissue library identifier.

Attribute.Name: toluene
Attribute.Description: Concentration of toluene in the sample

Attribute.Name: total N method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining the total N

Attribute.Name: total acid number
Attribute.Description: Total Acid Number (TAN) is a measurement of acidity that is determined by the amount of potassium hydroxide in milligrams that is needed to neutralize the acids in one gram of oil. It is an important quality measurement of crude oil. (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Total_acid_number)

Attribute.Name: total carbon
Attribute.Description: total carbon content

Attribute.Name: total depth of water column
Attribute.Description: measurement of total depth of water column

Attribute.Name: total dissolved nitrogen
Attribute.Description: total dissolved nitrogen concentration, reported as nitrogen, measured by: total dissolved nitrogen = NH4 + NO3NO2 + dissolved organic nitrogen

Attribute.Name: total inorganic nitrogen
Attribute.Description: total inorganic nitrogen content

Attribute.Name: total iron
Attribute.Description: Concentration of total iron in the sample

Attribute.Name: total nitrogen
Attribute.Description: total nitrogen content of the sample

Attribute.Name: total nitrogen content method
Attribute.Description: Reference or method used in determining the total nitrogen

Attribute.Name: total organic carbon
Attribute.Description: Definition for soil: total organic C content of the soil units of g C/kg soil. Definition otherwise: total organic carbon content

Attribute.Name: total organic carbon method
Attribute.Description: reference or method used in determining total organic C

Attribute.Name: total particulate carbon
Attribute.Description: total particulate carbon content

Attribute.Name: total phosphate
Attribute.Description: total amount or concentration of phosphate

Attribute.Name: total phosphorus
Attribute.Description: total phosphorus concentration, calculated by: total phosphorus = total dissolved phosphorus + particulate phosphorus. Can also be measured without filtering, reported as phosphorus

Attribute.Name: total sulfur
Attribute.Description: Concentration of total sulfur in the sample

Attribute.Name: train line
Attribute.Description: The subway line name, e.g., red, green, orange

Attribute.Name: train station collection location
Attribute.Description: The train station collection location, e.g., south station above ground, south station underground, south station amtrak, forest hills, riverside

Attribute.Name: train stop collection location
Attribute.Description: The train stop collection location, e.g., end, mid, downtown

Attribute.Name: travel outside the country in last six months
Attribute.Description: specification of the countries travelled in the last six months; can include multiple travels

Attribute.Name: trophic level
Attribute.Description: Feeding position in food chain (eg., chemolithotroph)

Attribute.Name: turbidity
Attribute.Description: turbidity measurement

Attribute.Name: twin sibling existence
Attribute.Description: specification of twin sibling presence

Attribute.Name: type of symbiosis
Attribute.Description: Type of biological interaction established between the symbiotic host organism being sampled and its respective host, e.g., commensalistic, mutualistic, parasitic

Attribute.Name: typical occupant density
Attribute.Description: customary or normal density of occupants

Attribute.Name: upstream intervention
Attribute.Description: List any known health-related interventions (prophylactic, therapeutic, and/or metaphylactic) administered to the host, i.e. vaccinations, hormonal patches, antibiotics, injections in feed, etc., e.g., prophylactic/metaphylactic antibiotics

Attribute.Name: urine collection method
Attribute.Description: specification of urine collection method

Attribute.Name: urogenital disorder
Attribute.Description: history of urogenital disorders, can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: urogenital tract disorder
Attribute.Description: history of urogenitaltract disorders; can include multiple disorders

Attribute.Name: vaccine received
Attribute.Description: Which vaccine did the host receive, e.g., Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine

Attribute.Name: ventilation rate
Attribute.Description: ventilation rate of the system in the sampled premises

Attribute.Name: ventilation type
Attribute.Description: ventilation system used in the sampled premises

Attribute.Name: vfa in formation water
Attribute.Description: Original volatile fatty acid concentration in the hydrocarbon resource

Attribute.Name: virus enrichment approach
Attribute.Description: Approach used to enrich the sample for viruses, if any. If more than one approach was used, include multiple ‘virus_enrich_appr’ fields.
Attribute.Format: ['', 'filtration', 'ultrafiltration', 'centrifugation', 'ultracentrifugation', 'PEG Precipitation', 'FeCl Precipitation', 'CsCl density gradient', 'DNAse', 'RNAse', 'targeted sequence capture', 'missing', 'not applicable', 'not collected', 'not provided', 'restricted access']

Attribute.Name: virus isolate of prior infection
Attribute.Description: Specific isolate of SARS-CoV-2 in prior infection (if known), e.g., SARS-CoV-2/human/USA/CA-CDPH-001/2020

Attribute.Name: viscosity
Attribute.Description: A measure of oil's resistance to gradual deformation by shear stress or tensile stress (e.g., 3.5 cp; 100C)

Attribute.Name: visual media
Attribute.Description: The building visual media, e.g., photos, videos, commonly of the building, site context (adjacent buildings, vegetation, terrain, streets), interiors, equipment, 3D scans

Attribute.Name: volatile fatty acids
Attribute.Description: Concentration of Volatile Fatty Acids in the sample

Attribute.Name: volatile organic compounds
